Reviews.Title: “Super Customer Service Tantalising Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn B
Reviews.Content: Yes their executive suits are expensive how ever. This room gives you more bang for your buck. Huge shower with three heads blowing great water pressure at you and massaging your muscles then after your vigourating shower they have a warm fluffy bathrobe waiting for you to put on. the king size bed is inviting and soft and the tv is huge. the living room looks over the statium and many other things. i felt like a queen. there is a guest room for pple that come to visit you and so much more. check it out you really want to.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what a life!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithfun77
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for couple of nights on 20th floor. OMG, the view is breathtaking!!!!!!! The hotel is brand new, everything is shiny and colorful and smells nice and new. We got a corner room so two walls were all glass from top to the bottom. My son did not want to leave the room, he enjoyed the view so much. The room was very clean and nicely decorated, the bathroom is big and very well designed.The halls are nice with beautiful artworks. We were very impressed with breakfast buffet, and it was not overpriced, only $16 per adult, $8 per child. The location is great, you can walk everywhere in downtown. We loved people at the hotel, everyone was so helpful and friendly. Overall, my new favorite!!!!!!!!! We highly recommend it to everyone. Kids friendly.

Reviews.Title: “BUSINESS TRAVEL”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1966_MI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at JWM Indianapolis for business meeting. Nice room overlooking city on high floor. King rooms have walk- in showers with multiple shower heads in wall. Breakfast buffet very good and not overly pricey. Also ate at High Velocity Sports Bar....good food, too. Will stay again on future visits to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer service, and a great view of the city!”
Reviews.Author: theworld2see
Reviews.Content: First stay at the JW in Indy was very nice. Customer service and the view are the two best things we first thought of after our stay. The rooms are nice, the bathroom is even nicer. The view from the top floor (our room was 3320) had a great view of the Zoo and Canal. The staff was truly friendly and helping. We did the breakfast buffet and it was about as good as hotel buffet breakfasts get! Parking is not cheap, but we came to hotel early Sat. and did not check out till well past the 24hr. period and still paid the one fee, so if you are doing a nite downtown leave the car early and enjoy the city. I would stay again and have told friends its a place I would recommend. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Back for my 2nd visit and still impressed”
Reviews.Author: cdoctor2
Reviews.Content: The facility is clean, fresh and the fitness center was the best Marriott fitness center I've visited. Very impressed over all. Most importantly, it's been a year since my last visit. On my first visit the hotel had been open for only a few months. On that visit I expected the staff to be especially courteous since they were making a first impression. I'm pleased to say that a year later, the impressive impression continues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriot - New facility”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an event. Greeted at the front door, escorted to check in by staff. Very interesting, nice experience. Facility was accommodating for the large event. The room I stayed in was a normal room, nothing exceptional. I would like to note that they have upped their game, and had a lot of Westin type features. I was impressed. Also, they have a newer shampoo and soap type...really nice...better than the soap from the last Marriot I stayed at. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel and no doubt one of the best in Indianapolis. It is practically brand new, and is within a reasonable walk of the major sporting venues downtown (Lucas Oil Field and Conseco Fieldhouse), as well as the NCAA Hall of Champions and other nearby museums. It is connected to the Indianapolis Convention Center, a large downtown mall, lots of restaurants, and other major buidlings downtown via a skywalk system. The only real downside is parking. The JW Marriott shares an underground parking garage with three other connected Marriott properties (a Courtyard, a Fairfield Inn, and a Springhill Suites). Each feeds into the same three level garage using different elevator banks, but guests at each are competing for the same spots. Much of the garage is taken up by "valet only" spaces. The weekend I was in town for the Big 10 tournament, the self-parking spaces frequently were full, leaving no choice but to pay for $40 a night valet parking or else park across the street in a public parking garage. A small inconvenience, but somewhat annoying nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: susanlee07
Reviews.Content: We were "downgraded" from the Westin due to overbooking so I thought this new hotel would be less than stellar. I was absolutely amazed! Our room was phenomenal. Two walls of windows with a spectacular view. Perfect for a NYE stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cousin11
Reviews.Content: I have had several awesome experiences at the JW Marriott! The staff are professional and very friendly! Everyone is willing to help you and accommodate your needs. The rooms are spacious and the beds are the most comfortable beds I have slept in. The views are great! The rooms are modern with the latest technology. Call ahead to ensure you get a high room with a view at no extra charge. The atmosphere is classy and upscale. Osteria Pronto is the Italian restaurant downstairs and it is great! If there is something not on the menu that you want, ask the chef and he will personally go get it for you! It's definitely one of the best hotels in Indy if not the best!! The negative side is that you have to pay for parking in the garage. I talked with the hotel desk clerk though and got it for free.

Reviews.Title: “The best in town”
Reviews.Author: Principissimo
Reviews.Content: It is the newest hotel in Indy. It is the biggest. It is the nicest. As some hotel in town it is linked by the skywalk to the convention center and to the center of the town: very usefull in the winter. There are two very good restaurants inside and a modern gym. It is five minute walking from the center. Go there if you stay in indy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: The little missus and I stayed on the 19th floor for three nights while we visited the annual Dealer Expo (motorcycle trade show) at the Convention Center. The location was terrific, in terms of proximity to the convention center and downtown activites (you can take the enclosed skywalk from the hotel to the convention center across the street and for several bocks to access the downtown eateries, pubs, shopping, etc. in inclement weather). Upon entering the lobby, one of the reservation staff who wait in front for arriving guests, greeted us warmly and escorted us to an individual tall granite carrel to sign us in. She was friendly and engaging, minimizing the process, which took perhaps three minutes. She then personally led us to the elevators and explained that our key card must be inserted once inside to enable access to upper floors when ascending to our room. From our room on the 19th floor (facing downtown) we enjoyed a wonderful perspective of downtown and Lucas Oil Stadium from the floor to ceiling windows. At night, we left the drapes open to view beautiful cityscape lights. Our room was spacious, appointed with beautiful, high quality furnishings. And the bed. . . . . Ah yes, the bed. Wow. I love my bed at home; spent a lot of money to get it just right, but the hotel bed was to die for. We slept like babies! This hotel is new, with nearly every amenity you might wish for, and what you'd expect from lodging of this caliber and expense. Guest services staff were quite helpful the three times I needed them (1. the programmable room safe needed a new battery - and security and maintenance were there within minutes, 2. We needed the room a bit cooler, but there was a limiter on the thermostat. Again, maintenance arrived and enabled cooler temps within 7 minutes, 3. I couldn't figure out the coffee maker - embarrassing, I know - and they quickly explained how the new fancy models worked without making me feel like an idiot). The main restaurant, Osteria Pronto (Italian), is where we chose to eat breakfast a couple of mornings. A bit expensive, but food quality and selection were excellent, including the breakfast buffet. We hope to stay here again next year. The experience was memorable, and despite the elevated expense, we felt like we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: stellamae77777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Indy JW for our 34th wedding anniversary. This was booked in advance, and I contacted the e-concierge also. On check in there was no mention of our special day, the check-in clerk was unfriendly. We were initially given a room with spectacularly close-up view of the roof & air conditioning system. I called the front desk and we were moved to a higher floor with better view. Dinner at the restaurant was just okay. Although they tout a world-famous chef, dinner was very routine, nothing special. I will say that any time I called the front desk our needs were met promptly. However, the in-room coffee service was sparse, just enough for 1 person, same with bathroom amenities. All that said, we have stayed at a lot nicer places than this JW. Sign me very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this visit”
Reviews.Author: pounchkee
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Feb 10 a week after the Super Bowl. We had a late check in and were told the restaurant Velocity would be open for at least 2 more hours. Dropped our bags in the room went straight to the restaurant sat at the bar for about 10 min only to be told they were closing early because slow night, There were at least 10 people sitting at the bar at that time. We like to stay at the JW Marriott, and have 3 times in the last 3 mos because it has bars and restaurants right within the hotel. We took a cab to another local restaurant and it was fine but not what we have come to expect from JW. The next am we went to the coffee shop in the breakfast restaurant they said they couldn't make latte's because of renovations. Went to StarBuck's within the hotel and they were out of 2 sizes of cups. It just seemed they were a little off their game, maybe because of the large crowds from the Super Bowl. Rooms clean and well appointed. Will give it another try, but hope services will be what I expected from the first 2 visits I made there.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Delivers!”
Reviews.Author: photophanatic
Reviews.Content: "Madonna slept here." At least that is what we were told. She stayed there during Superbowl week. View of the river from the top floor was spectacular! We did the room and breakfast which proved a good value. Eating towards the healthy end of the spectrum was easy. Ripe fruit, smoked salmon, yogurt and decent granola. If you prefer, you can do made to order omlet, eggs, bacon and sausage. All staff came from the Marriott mold. My wife is a quilter; the concierge recommended a cute little shop near downtown. Great place - Crimson Tate; unusual fabric. If you are looking for a bit more upscale lodging with above average service, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and upscale hotel and conference center”
Reviews.Author: TimoLV
Reviews.Content: This hotel's staff have been trained to the ultimate in customer service and this hotel truly encompasses the vision of JW Marriott. The common areas are immaculately clean and hospitable and the rooms have been cleaned to an impeccable level. The bedding, and beds are comfortable and my stay was relaxing and tranquil. I would definitely stay and eat here again. I was 110% satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Indianapolis is the ultimate winner!”
Reviews.Author: OzEleonora
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are sitting at the Indianapolis airport waiting for our flight back to LA. Our experience during the Superbowl even was absolutely fantastic! The city of Indianapolis did a marvelous job of hosting the large crowds. Traffic was a bit chaotic, but that's to be expected. The city is so compact, cozy and safe that walking to everything was a breeze. Especially since you could use the skywalk to get to most places. And the JW Marriott did a fantastic job of hosting a massive amount of celebrities, former players, TV analysts, corporate executives, journalists and the NFL itself. The crowds were large and demanding, yet the staff remained extremely polite and friendly at all times. The people of Indianapolis showed other cities what a good host does, which is to make the guests feel special and welcome no matter how hectic things get. Well done Indianapolis and JW Marriott! The NFL would be absolutely crazy not to bring the the Superbowl back to Indianapolis very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Downtown Hotel in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas for work and I almost forgot I was traveling over the holiday. The rooms are upscale and the main restaurant had a fabulous buffet. I'd definitely stay here again. I've stayed at the Marriott, Hyatt, Westin, and Hilton but none of these hotels can compare to the sophistication that the JW offers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new, high-end touches”
Reviews.Author: MIAnonymous
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a quick work-related trip and was very happy with the hotel. Everything is very new with modern style and clean lines, there were high-end surfaces in the common areas and guest rooms, and the bathroom was spotless. Nice bar area and restaurant design, too. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kbryant
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for pre-super bowl events and was very satisfied. Beautiful hotel - modern in style but very comfortable. Agree with other posters on most items. First night was greeted promptly and had excellent service throughout our stay. Hotel was much more crowded on Saturday and Sunday as super bowl came closer. They said they were sold out from now through the actual event. Excellent breakfast in restaurant. We had a package and it was free. Velocity restaurant had great atmosphere, and food okay. Pool area overrun with kids. Blame the parents - no control over them and there was a swim team staying there that invited their friends over from other hotels. Not sure if this amount of kids is normal on a non-super bowl week. They will fill your ice cooler with ice - just call room service. Big city style with local hospitality. We'll be back for another weekend stay!

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott in Downtown Indianapolis is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nathan S
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott in Downtown Indianapolis is a great location that features everything you'd expect from a JW property and more. One of the best things is that it is attached to the Convention Center, through which you can access most of the other Downtown Properties, so you never have to go outside in the cold, rain or heat. Check-in was easy and the staff was very attentive to my request for a room on a very high floor so as to avoid hearing street noise (I am a light sleeper). My Platinum status placed me on the top floor of the hotel, with access to the Concierge Lounge's great breakfast buffet (free) and evening heavy hors d'ouerves (which served as dinner because it was so large and diverse). The beds are great, the choice of TV channels is excellent, the room has good lighting and the bathroom was spacious (but in king-bedded rooms, you only get a very large shower, no tub) and very well appointed in terms of amenities. There are two restaurants in the lobby. The sports bar is always busy and has some reasonably-priced food; the Italian restaurant is pricey and I did not try it. Lunch in the sports bar ran $10 for a good meal, and there were lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: bmsnls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for a long weekend and had an amazing time! I can't say enough about the wonderful staff at this hotel. Everyone from the valet attendents, to the front desk to housekeeping were very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and really nice. The view was spectacular and the beds were very comfortable. We needed an extra blanket and within minutes (not hours like most hotels) our blanket was at the door. I would highly recommend this hotel while staying in Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Indianapolis Pre Super Bowl Experience”
Reviews.Author: Misterpod
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 29th floor facing east with a fabulous view of downtown Indianapolis and Lucas Oil Stadium. Other friends had a room facing west, which was nice however if given the opportunity I would suggest the downtown view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality with a spectacular view of Indy skyline”
Reviews.Author: Jd-itgeek
Reviews.Content: Here for the super bowl events and everything has been super great. Skywalks to all the attractions, the hotel is perfectly located and the view from the room is amazing. Overlooking the Super bowl village with perfect view of the Indy skyline and Lucas oil stadium. Waking up to an amazing sunrise. All the JW Marriott staff including the manager himself, we're extremely hospitable. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Em2729
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott the week before the Super Bowl in Indianapolis. They were really on top of everything. The service was awesome and the staff friendly and helpful. They were more than willing to go out of there way for you help you find restaurants and accommodate you in every way. They have an onsite spa so you can book massages. $89 for an hour long massage and it was wonderful. Stayed on the 30th floor. Fantastic view- windows went from the floor to the ceiling. Room was immaculate and I found the bed and pillows quite comfortable. There were other people on the floor but the rooms were so quiet I couldn't hear anything. Bathroom was very nice. Glass shower and three shower heads. The location was great and didn't seem that pricey given it being Super Bowl time. Food & drink prices reasonable. Nice lobby bar w/ unique cocktails. Try the ginger crush cocktail very delicious. It's a downtown hotel I will definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Where to begin”
Reviews.Author: sue026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JWMarriott this past weekend for a gymnastics meet. I expected it to be a little on the louder side but not as bad as it was. I was woken up several times both nights bu fire tucks and police sirens outside. It sounded as if they were coming thru my window. Then we also so ropes that were hanging from the ceiling that kept banging on the window. I had not realized that was what the noise was till it was light outside and say the ropes there. Valet parking is $35 a night. When I got home I realized that my license plate is bent and the frame is broken... ugh. At least say something. Overal service was EXCELLENT. We did have an issue at the sports bar for dinner but other then that very impressed. Beds are comfortable and thermostat works great. Shower head is outdate and the water did not drain very well in the tub. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: gopoets
Reviews.Content: The service at the JW Marriott Indianapolis was superb. The workers really made the stay outstanding. The hotel is nice and relatively new. The club floor lounge was outstanding with excellent food offerings all day long. The room was OK in size while the bathroom was large. I'd stay there again for sure. The views from the high level rooms were outstanding as well.

Reviews.Title: “JW or Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: hogburn
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across the JW when I was unable to get home to Chicago on a Friday night. This is one of the better Marriott's in the country. I swear it has hints of a Ritz Carlton stay in terms of ambiance and client service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheelchix80
Reviews.Content: Incredible new JW. Had corner room on the 28th floor overlooking baseball stadium and Lucas Oil Stadium. Fantastic view. Great concierge lounge with full breakfast and evening meal. Full gym instead of a few machines. Convenient parking under the hotel. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. First time the manager has personally escorted me to my room. Enjoyed sitting in front of fire in lobby lounge in the evening with glass of wine. Can't say enough good things about this place. Will definitely stay there again the next time I am in Indianapolis or even passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and connected to Skywalk”
Reviews.Author: MaryLouise53
Reviews.Content: I loved my experience at this hotel! The service is excellent starting with the guys who greated me from my taxi, check in staff at reception, housekeeper and the employees at the bars and restaurants. Every morning when I walked past the bell desk I was greated like a celebrity - warmly and respectfully. The beds were super comfy, and the room well appointed. I was upgraded to a corner room which had great views of Lucas Stadium and the canal. Bottled water is free as is the coffee in the room. The sky walk was very convenient since it was very cold! I used it to walk to the convention center every day as well as to restaurants and bars. I was very impressed with the prices in the hotel restaurants. Maybe I am just used to over priced hotel facilities. I was very impressed and wished I was staying there for the Superbowl!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christina K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night before flying out for our honeymoon the next morning. The staff was friendly and helpful from the moment we pulled up to the building. Check in was quick and easy. We stayed on the 28th floor and the view was breath taking. The floor to ceiling windows were what sold this hotel to me when I was researching hotels and they did not disappoint. We ordered room service that night (at 2:30 am) and it arrived quickly and was delicious. We also had breakfast at Osteria Pronto... the breakfast was buffet with plenty of choices of food, all which were amazing. We will, without a doubt, be returning!

Reviews.Title: “A behemoth of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevHurst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3-day conference in September. It was my first time in Indianapolis. Was really impressed by the size of the place - it's absolutely huge - you could probably spend a whole day walking around it (the place even has its own Starbucks!) As it's fairly new, everything was in pristine condition and my room was finished to a really high standard. I had a corner room, pretty high up, which had floor-to-ceiling windows along two sides. This meant fantastic views in the day (wow, Indianapolis is flat!) and the views at night were gorgeous. As it was a corner room the room was big and had more than enough space for me. The bed was really comfy and everything was absolutely spotless. The only thing I disliked was the air con. It was like there was only 3 settings: cold, more cold or off. It was a bit frustrating not to be able to control the temperature yourself. Also, had a bit of an issue not being able to connect to the room WiFi (but this could've been because of the conference going on). Anyway, I reported it, it was resolved quickly and I was given 24 hours complimentary service, so I was quite impressed by that. Check-in was fast (considering the amount of people they were attending the conference) and service was spot-on. Overall, this is a great hotel which has everything you could ask for, which made for a very comfortable stay. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Austin, Texas (We're full...so come visit, then leave)
Reviews.Title: “The JW...Just Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ap3266
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a gymnastics meet held at the convention center. When booking, you will want to upgrade to the concierge level. More on that shortly. Check in was prompt and efficient. Staff were very helpful. Hotel layout is fantastic except some of the elevators don't go to some floors so look sharp. Hotel rooms were spacious and clean. Have everything you would need except for maybe a refrigerator or microwave. Our shower was great...had three jets and the water was fabulously hot. There is a Starbucks on the second floor. A real Starbucks, not a "we serve Starbucks." There are two restaraunts in the hotel. I didn't eat at the Italian place but it looked rather pricey. The sports bar was very upscale and had a good selection of food and drinks, at about regular pricing. The food there was pretty good. If you have a chance to upgrade to an executive room or get upgraded, you will want to check out the Lounge on the 31st floor. They have snacks out all day, breakfast in the mornings, sodas and waters in refrigerators all day and beer/wine for purchase in the evenings. Plenty of TV's and couches for relaxing. Very comfortable for unwinding. Hotel is centrally located and connected via skywalk to the convention center and other hotels. There is a mall in walking distance as well as numerous other restaraunts at all price levels. They do have a gym and indoor pool. Gym had ellipticals, treadmills, machine weights and some free weights. Was health club quality for sure. And they have chilled wet towels for cooling off, if one might need that in Indianapolis in the winter. In closing, this was perhaps the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Very clean, very upscale. If I could choose one hotel to live in, this would probably be it. Very impressed and glad we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SB83616
Reviews.Content: Great new JW Mariott. Convenient to downtown, convention center, Lucas oil stadium. Try for a room on 33rd floor with access to executive lounge. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior0219
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night (in town for a concert). Staff was amazing. Hotel was brand new or newly renovated. Very, very clean. Ate in the casual restaurant (forget the name)...food was good, as was the service. Rooms were typical of most nice Marriott’s....clean, sleek. We were high up, so we a great view of downtown. Also, it's a convention hotel so it has a Starbucks...yeah!

Reviews.Title: “be careful there are 2 mariotts downtown across the street from each other this one is swank”
Reviews.Author: jm0m
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the executive suite with my husband at a discounted rate the night of 1/1/12. Excellent hotel. Brand new. The suite had a double shower with all kinds of shower heads and plenty of hot water. king bed. 2 baths. no tub. 2 TVs. Mattress very comfortable. View fantastic. Nice small pool in building with a hot tub. Very nice gym with view. Had room service for breakfast which was very tasty. They forgot salt and pepper but brought it quickly when I called. Mini fridge and coffee maker in room. The room was clean. We stayed on the 28th floor and the wind was a bit loud but didn't bother me. Excellent heating and a/c system adjustable by the half degree digitally. 2 restaurants on property. Tried the non Italian restaurant for drinks and dessert and was very good(this is also the restaurant that does the room service). Parking is expensive($30/night) but was free for us because of the holiday. There is a government parking lot that may be available at times and is worth a try because it is much less expensive. This hotel is in a wonderful location and has walkways to many other destinations like the Convention Center and Circle Centre Mall.

Reviews.Title: “One of Indy's finest hotels”
Reviews.Author: Gomo K
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the lobby, someone is there to greet you, check you in, and make all your wishes come true. But seriously, they do try to accommodate all your request the best can. I was able to get a room on the 30th floor, city view, and complimentary access to the concierge lounge; not bad for my first stay. You'll definitely noticed how courteous the staff is after they walk you to the elevator and show how operate it using your room key; an extra touch that adds to the class of the hotel. The room was stunning and tastefully designed with ceiling to floor windows that added to the breath-taking views. For anyone visiting Indy, I would highly recommend this hotel. Positives: Courteous staff, Tastefully appointed rooms, Accessibility to downtown attractions, Wide range of services and amenities. Negatives: Parking, internet access, and renting in-room movies is a little bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Great new addition for Indy”
Reviews.Author: Wilkimber
Reviews.Content: This is a spectacular addition to Indianapolis that is really convenient for the Convention Center, to which it is linked by a walkway, and the Lucas Oils stadium. It is also a brisk walk to the city center, either on the street of through the myriad walkways. Firstly, from beginning to end of my week's stay there, the staff were attentive and polite, the only hiccup being the safe in my room that malfunctioned but it was immediately dealt with, the remedy being a new one being installed. There are two restaurants, the High Velocity sports bar is just that - nothing special about it except that it's a handy facility to have on your doorstep. The Osteria Pronto restaurant was extremely good, so good in fact that my wife and I ate there a couple of times. It is not cheap, but if you are a wine drinker, then the cost can be somewhat contained as it is supplied in a variety of measures to suit both the pallet and the wallet. Although I'm not an avid gym addict it was one of the best, if not the best, gym I have ever used. All the equipment was very new, as is to be expected, but a nice touch was the plentiful supply of refrigerated wet towels that were there for guests' use. Alongside the gym was the smallish swimming pool but I cannot really comment on it as I did not use it. A spacious, well laid out room with a comfy bed made sure that I got a good sleep every night. All in all, a great new hotel and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhulsla
Reviews.Content: I stayed JW Marriot in Indianapolis from November 13th to the 18th, and was there for a conference. My room (room number 2829) was pretty nice and comfortable. The bed was soft with puffy beddings, but I didn’t sweat, so it wasn’t overly hot. A large (32’?) flat screen, high def TV was there. The bathroom was pretty small, a table for a basin area, the commode, and a standup shower. However the shower was really nice, it had the typical multi water stream style head, but it also had faucets in the wall, so you could get spray from many directions. The bad thing though there wasn’t enough pressure to get a strong stream from the overhead and side faucets at the same time. The view from the room was of parking structures, other hotels, and Peyton Manning’s place (Lucas Oil Stadium) off in the distance, about two blocks away. They have staff that greet you at the enterance and take you to check in, very welcoming. Also, the elevators are very fast and smooth, it really helps such a tall hotel. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, but it’s a good mile, in one direction. We found a German restaurant one night, they had great food. Alas, I can’t remember the name. The conference I attended had over 800 people, and there was plenty of conference space for our group, and there were other functions there too. The general session and breakfast/lunch room had plenty of space as well. I felt the hotel did NOT do a good job with food for the conference though, just low quality. Plenty of food, but it didn’t taste all that good, and I am not a picky eater and am usually satisfied. The break out conference rooms had sizes for big and small groups, they were properly ventilated as they weren’t too hot, nor too cold. My two concerns were the chairs were pretty hard and uncomfortable and the meeting rooms were pretty spread out, so you cold have a long haul between sessions.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmmmm WOW1”
Reviews.Author: BikeBum
Reviews.Content: Writing this from my room, 29 floors up from the ground with a magnificent view! I napped a corner room, with floor to ceiling windows on two walls, looking out over the river and the Indy Museum. AAA rate, with breakfast for two, $159.00! This room is spectacular! I am not posting my pics as they do not do the room justice. $35 to valet your car? HEY, THIS IS NOT SAN FRANCISCO! Room is super quiet, a fantastic shower, great bed, the same Samsung TV I have at home, what could be better! Guess if I had someone to share breakfast with,,,,,, but that is another story. ;-) Thank you JW Marriot Indy!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: ags35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night after his holiday party in the hotel's ballroom. The lobby area is beautiful and check in was quick and easy. I was concerned that our view wouldn't be great as we were on the back side of the hotel, but we had a great view of White River State Park. Ask for a higher floor and either side will have a great view. The room was very large and exceptionally clean and well appointed. A mistake on our bill was quickly taken care of and we had a great night in the hotel. We would recommend the hotel to anyone coming to Indy for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuAlAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time at the recently opened JW Marriott in Indianapolis. The hotel and rooms are tastefully done up. The amenities are great with several restaurants and bars and the gym is well equipped. The breakfast buffet has an excellent choice and you can eat a full American breakfast or stay healthy with fruit and yogurt. The internet connectivity is very good in both the rooms and the public areas. The staff is very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What Can I Say But FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Roxegirl
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott in Indianapolis really knows how to pamper its guests. We have visited twice in the last couple of months and have totally enjoyed ourselves. The first time we used the shopping package and received a gift card to use at Simon Mall which is the Circle Centre Mall and the breakfast buffet on Sunday. The 2nd visit we used a Marriott EBreak rate the weekend of Thanksgiving. We were on the 27th floor and could see Monument Circle where they had the "tree" lighting on Friday evening. They do not have ice machines on each floor and when you are in need of ice, you just pick up the phone and call and they bring it right to your door. The room service is excellent. They usually say 30 - 45 minutes but it is never that and all the employees are so kind and considerate. The corridors are very quiet at night - have never heard a sound in the halls. I will go back and back and back to this hotel. It is so convenient to the Indianapolis Zoo, Victory Field and Lucas Oil Stadium where the Colts play.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend - just because”
Reviews.Author: JustMeNU4
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' & I spent a weekend in this new hotel a month ago. We had a great time. Our package included a buffett breakfast. Parking was pricey for Indianapolis but I guess we will have to get use to it when the Super Bowl comes..We had dinner in the bar in the lobby. Loved the lettuce wraps & the Arnold Palmer tea (alcohol included) drinks. This is a great hotel and great place to stay when in Indy

Reviews.Title: “Help everywhere”
Reviews.Author: LaTiDaMI
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place. Helpful and friendly staff are everywhere. I was met at the door by someone who took care of my registration and then walked me to the elevator that went to my floor with no hand held out for a tip. The rooms are very clean, large, and well appointed. Restaurants and bars are first class. Nothing at this property is a bargain, but I left feeling I had received an excellent return on my money.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Carol G
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful property. The food was great and the room was clean My husband reserved a king but was told there were none available when we checked in. Took over 3 hours to get our luggage up from the car. We were given card for money off whatever we would spend at the hotel so we appreciated that. The beds were very uncomfortable very very firm. Took too long on check out to get our luggage from holding after my husbands conference. But everyone was very polite. We got a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a sweet surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the JW Marriott in Indianapolis on Friday 11/25/11 to celebrate his birthday. The front desk staff took personalized, extra steps to have a sweet surprise waiting for us upon returning from dinner to help make his birthday special.. Their extra effort and attention to detail really left a great impression on us. The view of the city from the 32nd floor was breathtaking and the shower was awesome as well. All little details, but it added up to a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with long delayed check in and poor hotel service in the elite lounge.”
Reviews.Author: CptHulka
Reviews.Content: I had expected a better hotel that other Marriott locations we have stayed at before. As a platinum elite member I had hopes for this location while taking my family here but was greatly disappointed. Upon arrival after 4:00 room was not ready. We had to wait an hour and half for housekeeping after being told it would take only 30 minutes. We had plan on shopping but lost value time waiting on JW. It would have taken longer if we had not ask what was taking so long. Found out they forgot about us. We waited in the lounge for elite members but they appeared to be unprepared as there were no snacks available and would not restock. Also upon our return in the evening the lounge was was also out of dessert and was told sorry again due to being unprepared again. Room was OK but rather small compared to other Marriott locations we have visited. Currently considering canceling future reservations due to poor service. The hotel is a long walk to anywhere interesting other than the convention center. Forget about carrying shopping bags from the Circle Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MyLadyWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights for the Big Ten Championship. I don't think we could have chosen a nicer hotel. From the moment we arrived at the hotel to our departure, the employees were the most accomodating I have ever met. Having access to the Concierge level was a bonus. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel Adding a refrigerator to the room would be a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Big Ten football championship & everything was first class. The staff is very professional & polite, from the valet to the front desk clerk to the bell hop. The room is very well decorated & we had a great view of the city from the 30th floor. We had access to the Executive Lounge, which I highly recommend...free Pepsi products & snacks. The location is perfect for attending a football game or any other event in the downtown area. I highly recommend the JW Marriott for the traveler that likes to be pampered. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chipmunk72
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel..... I thought the room was nice, spacious and clean. We ate at the sports bar and I had a burger that was really good. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: eokauai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JWM on a recent business trip and we had a three-day conference there. Food and service were outstanding. Room was beautiful, spacious and floor to ceiling glass on two walls, so it had an amazing view. This hotel is definitely my top choice in Indianapolis, I've stayed at the Hilton and the regular Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minnow1982
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the JW after a wedding. It was fabulous. The decor is fresh and contemporary and everything is (of course) brand new and sparkling. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. We did eat & drink at High Velocity off the lobby. The ambiance is fantastic but the service left quite a bit to be desired. The rooms are well appointed but are missing a mini bar and fridge. That was surprising for a hotel of this status. The views are fantastic! We faced the city which was stunning at night - you can see the "Christmas Tree" downtown and the beautiful skyline. Park views are also beautiful. This is a unique and fun choice in the myriad of run of the mill downtown hotels. I would choose it over the stuffy Conrad any day.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive downtown Indianapolis hotel”
Reviews.Author: phimugrls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW last month for a conference. I live in Indianapolis, so I only stayed one night at this hotel for a four day conference. The rooms are very similar to any other JW. They are very clean and the materials used throughout are of high qualities. The bathroom was very large, and contained a great multi-shower head shower. I only stayed one night, but with my Marriott rewards, I had access to the club level lounge. This was a nice feature as well. There were plenty if options for breakfast, and an evening cocktail. Finally, as eapected, the service at this hotel is top notch! Several employees have been assigned to different areas of this hotel, so if you need anything...someone will be waiting to help! If you are able to secure a decent rate at this hotel (the prices seem to always be changing), the experience is worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Best view in the city”
Reviews.Author: singgirl17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for one night this past weekend. I was impressed by how quickly I was greeted by the staff at the front desk and the quick check-in. We stayed on the 25th floor and had a spectacular view of the city. The bathroom was quite luxurious at first, but the door into the bathroom and shower door can make it a bit awkward to use, and the toilet paper holder is not easy to use as well. The room was quite spacious and had very contemporary decor. I felt that they did cut corners in quality of decor and furniture around the room. The mattress was firm and made it difficult to sleep peacefully through the night. My husband slept perfectly, and I understand that this may be different for everyone. The office chair was already showing some wear and tear, and the decor seemed cheap. JW could have put a little more effort into the quality in the rooms for being a luxury hotel, but it was overall a pleasant stay. I would stay again at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: tpuszcz
Reviews.Content: My son, wife and I were at the JW for three nights in November. I was in for a conference and the others were off of school so they came along. On the fist night my wife and son went looking for a pop machine, they asked at the bar and was told "there are no pop macines in the hotel." The bartender promptly gave them a pepsi and a rootbeer. The second day their adventure was riding a city bus and exploring the Childrens Museum. He bought a toy submarine that needed baking soada to work. My wife asked the kitchen and was given a large quantity of baking soda. Great view and comfortable beds work but "happy wife = happy life"

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with an awesome view of the city”
Reviews.Author: LAlexander01
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant hotel stay and the customer service here is like no other hotel, it was extremely nice. Our room was a little smaller than I expected, but overall very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Excellent, Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewjv1955
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new, excellent, outstanding Marriott hotel facility. I stayed here for the National Catholic Youth Conference for 4 days on the 27th floor in a King Sized Executive room with access to the Concierge level suite. The room was tastefully appointed and had a wonderfully comfortable bed, a huge desk, a breathtaking view of the city and river, and a large, wonderful bath. But the greatest thing about the room was the access to the lounge! They had a complimentary daily breakfast that was the largest and best breakfast buffet of any hotel I have ever stayed in: tasty special treats made by the chef, eggs, meats, pastries, coffees, and more! Plus the lounge was open all day long with an honor bar. At night, there were snacks and Hors d'oeuvres and even warm deserts. The Concierge up there and the staff were wonderfully friendly. The views up there in the lounge were great. This was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in. You couldn't here anything outside the room. The downstairs restaurants were excellent! You have to try the restaurants downstairs too---both were outstanding. The calamari was the best I've ever had! It was truly unique--no where else have I had a calamari like this--with pearl onions, carrots, and other wonderful treats inside. I went back TWICE just to have that! Plus the bar was lovely. This is a real gem of a Marriott! Truly 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience This Year”
Reviews.Author: IndyCharles
Reviews.Content: Front desk was attentive, efficient, and friendly. Outstanding view of the city given the right room. Excellent location for downtown events of any nature. Best Marriott room I have ever encountered in Indiana. Parking prices seemed steep for registered guests.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again depending on the rate”
Reviews.Author: Luve2Travel35
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Indianapolis, I've now stayed at all the properties that connect to this hotel. The JW Marriott was the nicest, but it lacked a few things that I enjoy. I knew this going in, so I can't really mark them down for that. Parking: Self-parking is $28, and the garage is underground. Access this on Washington Street, just past the entrance to the SpringHill Suites. All three connecting hotels use this same garage. Get ticket upon entrance and bring it with you to check-in, where your key will be programmed to allow you to exit the garage. Don't forget to do this, as there are no parking attendants at the exit. While the garage is color-coded based on the hotel in which you are staying, there is no reason why you have to park in your designated color if there is no room available. The additional walk from a different colored area will be about 2 minutes. We had to drive around the garage twice to find an open spot that was not designated for valet parking, which was only about 50% full. Check-In: This took less than 10 minutes even though there was a line. Elevators: Some people don't like the key card access for the elevators, but I am a fan of this for safety reasons. No one can get past the second floor without a key unless they are with a hotel guest. Lobby: Beautiful and plenty of seating. Restaurants are on this level. Starbucks is on second floor near the entrance to the skywalk that leads to a parking structure and the Indianapolis Convention Center. Sadly, Starbucks was closed at 6:30 pm on a Saturday evening. Room: We had a "park view" room that was beautiful. The floor to ceiling windows are great. The room was a decent size (2 queens) and very clean. There was a desk chair and high back chair but no sofa for guest seating. The neighboring SpringHill Suites includes a separate seating area, which is nice for larger groups. On the other hand, large groups could just use the beautiful lobby at the JW. There are no refrigerators or microwaves. The bathroom was a good size, nice layout and very clean. We were in a room next to the stairs, and the people going up/down were very, very loud. This is not the fault of the hotel, but check your room location if this will bother you in the middle of the night. Dining: Room service took over an hour, but we were not in a hurry. The weekend breakfast/brunch at Osteria Pronto was excellent. I enjoyed that it was served until 1 pm on weekends, allowing us to have a leisurely morning. We checked out, stored bags, and had breakfast at noon. The food was great, but even better was the staff. From the waitress to the omelette cook to the person clearing tables, everyone was so friendly and efficient. Other: The hotel is within walking distane to just about everything - Lucas Oil Stadium, Convention Center, City Centre Mall, etc. While it would be cold in the winter, there are a good number of skywalks connecting things in this city. Cons: I got an excellent rate for this hotel, but it did not include a fridge, microwave, breakfast, parking, sitting area or internet ($12.95). The SpringHill Suites, next door, while not as elegant included all of these things for the same price (minus parking). That hotel is connected to this one, so the skywalks, restaurants, pool, Starbucks and nice lobby can be used by anyone. I knew all of this when making my reservation, so I won't complain about it. I just want readers to think about this when making a reservation. There is a spot for a fridge within the hotel room itself, but you have to request that one be brought up. I'm not sure if this would cost extra. The internet charge is ridiculous when it's free next door. The breakfast was excellent, so book a room with a breakfast package if possible. Parking is typical for a big city. Just keep all of this in mind when choosing a rate for the room. You'll pay at least an additional $75 if you want breakfast in a JW restaurant, parking and internet. All in all, very good experience and very nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! All the best of everything!”
Reviews.Author: MummeyM
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in! Everything is brand new and clean. Helpful staff and every amenity you could ever want in a hotel. Very cool bathroom and super comfortable beds. Windows are like 12 feet and take up the whole wall for excellent views! The only negative for me was the $28 self-parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night and paid for the romance package which included strawberries and champagne and late checkout. When we got back from our wedding, the strawberries and champagne were not in our room so we asked the front desk and they said they couldn't deliver those after midnight but we could have them the next day (not as romantic at 10am on a Sunday morning). The next morning, despite our late checkout (3pm), housekeeping knocked on our door around 10am and I informed them of our late checkout, they apologized, yet came back again about a half hour later. Our stay was not romantic and not relaxing so we left early and just went home. I've stayed here several other times and yes, it's a beautiful hotel and the service is generally great, but very disappointed that we didn't get what we paid extra for on our special day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cort43202
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Wasn't sure I'd like a contemporary hotel but this one is really nice. I would definitely stay here again. Rooms were very clean. We also ate at the Sunday buffet which was also very good. It was $16 for the regular buffet and $25 if you wanted Bloody Mary's. The sports bar, Velocity, was crowded on a Saturday night and had plenty of TV's. Located on the west side of downtown Indy, you could walk indoors all the way to Lucas Oil Stadium or the Circle Center Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: SassyOwatonna_MN
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay here for a convention and it was very, very good. Everyone was very helpful and polite. The food in the restuarants was good. The rooms were very nice and clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. Including the shower. The only complaint I have is the fact that there was no refridgerator in the room and the only place to get ice was on the 2nd floor and I was on the 26th floor. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - attentive staff & gorgeous view”
Reviews.Author: TravelinKiki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. From start to finish, the JW Marriott staff did everything possible to ensure that my stay was a positive one. When we checked in, we were walked to the elevators. On the way, I mentioned leftovers from lunch, and the employee offered to send a refrigerator up to the room. It arrived promptly, and the front desk called to ensure that all was satisfactory. Upon checkout, we checked with the concierge about catching the IndyGo shuttle, and we were given a coupon for $2 off a ride. In addition, the room was well-appointed and had a beautiful city view. I also really appreciated the connected Skyway to the Centre City Mall and restaurants in downtown. I didn't need to carry my bulky jacket with me - it was great! I just wish that WiFi was included in my room rate. For me, that is a must-have.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location and loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: JJTravelGal
Reviews.Content: You can easily spot the JW Marriott in Indy, it serves as a great point of reference as you wander around downtown because that massive blue structure is always within view. This hotel opened in February 2011 and is supposedly the world's largest JW Marriott. This is a very clean and nice hotel that's connected to other Marriott owned hotels in the surrounding area as well as the Convention Center, Lucas Oil stadium and Circle Centre Mall. You also have a nice walking area near the White State River park. All the aforementioned places are about a 5-10 min walk from the hotel. There's a lot of sports bar type of establishments and steak houses a few blocks away - that seems to be the common theme in that area. Overall: - very new and clean; nice design - very friendly and attentive staff - clean room and bathroom; decent bed and soft sheets and good temperature control - quiet area near a running/walking trail at White State River Park The main lobby here as two restaurants - one is a sports bar called High Velocity and the other is Osteria Pronto. Osteria Pronto offers a fab breakfast buffet ($16) - it is probably one of the better hotel breakfasts I've had. Everything tasted fresh and I like that there were lots of healthy choices. The staff here are great! Wifi is not free - only in the lobby area. Ask the front desk about the password. The area is safe, the only "downside" is that the area is quiet in the evenings. If I were coming back to Indy, I'd definitely stay here again. The hotel is about a $35 cab ride from the airport (before tip). There is a cheaper option to get to the airport - a shuttle that costs about $7 that's within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First-Class Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mturner85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott while in Indianapolis for a conference and it was first class in nearly all respects. The hotel is located in the heart of the downtown area, just a few blocks from Lucas Oil Stadium, the convention center and right next to a minor league baseball stadium. I was immediately welcomed by the staff and the interior of the hotel and its facilities were very nice and well-kept. There is a small indoor pool and hot tub and a large, well-equipped work out area. My room was on the 29th floor giving me a great view of the river and the adjacent IUPUI campus. The Italian restaurant on the first floor was excellent and they also have a sports bar with lots of room to sit and socialize and above average bar food. My room was very nice and large, lots of room to spread out and work or relax. The furniture and decorations are also nice and well-kept. Overall, this is an extremely nice hotel, a definite step above most others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..... best in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler486
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times this year on business and thought it was time to write a review. This hotel is awesome and by far my favorite in Indianapolis. The staff is top shelf. The hotel is new, rooms are great and the concierge floor is one of the best I've ever experienced. The gym is better than most health clubs. Just thought you should know... Don't stay anywhere else in Indy... this hotel takes First Place!

Reviews.Title: “One of my best experiences with Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: IUMike1970
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here Halloween weekend. Quite simply one of the best Marriotts where I have stayed. The lobby, common spaces and rooms are tastefully designed. Rooms are more spacious than at most marriotts, and we had an excellent view of the white river park. Concierge lounge was fully stocked, had excellent view of downtown, and best of all is open on weekends. One of the best hotel fitness rooms I have seen. And paid under $100 a night, and were even comped for the valet parking. Staff was very friendly, no line at check in. Definitely would stay again any time I am in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randalen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott in Indianapolis for a conference in October. It was an excellant stay! The staff was very professional and friendly - especially the front desk staff. Rooms were well appointed and cozy. Everything in the hotel sparkled with newness. The hotel was also within walking distance to downtown restaurants and entertainment. I used the Indy Go shuttle from the airport and was quite impressed. Reasonably priced and very convenient - drops off and picks up right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, nice, clean comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: GoesTo11
Reviews.Content: I'm having a hard time finding something to complain about at this hotel. Overall the hotel gets 5 stars, their restaurants would be a bit lower (more on them below). My room was great- very new, quiet, nice linens, very comfy mattress, great shower/tub and amenities. Free wifi throughout the hotel. I had a city view room which was awesome. But even the other side is nice with views of the White River. See pics. Hotel is only 9 months old I think. Only thing that would have made it even better would be a fridge and microwave. If you're going to a convention or a game the location is awesome. It's connected to the convention center, which is connected to Lucas Oil Stadium, several other hotels, and the mall downtown. You don't even have to go outside, which is great in bad weather. Also walking distance to the minor league stadium, all museums, downtown, movie theatre, White River state park, and the zoo. The staff was so helpful, polite, always smiling and friendly. There are 3 restaurants and a central bar. High Velocity is a sports bar with tons of TVs, every major sporting even was on. Food was just so so but service was excellent. Osteria Pronto is Italian. Not the best ever but pretty good, had their minestrone soup twice it was so good, and the gnocchi was pretty good. You can have a drink at the central bar area and order take out from Osteria Pronto. That was a nice option to room service. I didn't try the last place. Had room service breakfast one day and it was awesome. The fresh fruit plate was huge and delicious. 3 kinds of berries, two kinds of melons, pineapple, grapes, and yogurt. Starbucks on the second floor next to the walkway to the convention center. I did a lot of walking and dining in other hotels. From what I see the JW is the newest and nicest. There are actually 3 Marriotts in a row, so make sure you pick the right one, the other two look a bit old. Went to Shula's in the other Marriott for lunch, pretty good. Went to the Capital Grill twice in the Conrad, really good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly, and new”
Reviews.Author: zed1958
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the JW Marriott on 10/24/11 and 10/25/11, spending the night in one of the rooms on the 9th floor with a great view of the Indianapolis skyline. The hotel has been open since February 2011. The remarkable experience about staying at the JW Marriott was the fact that virtually every employee that I interacted with greeted me or offered to provide assistance in some way. The staff goes out of its way to make guests feel welcome, to the point that the reception desk personnel stand in front of their desks to greet arriving guests. I arrived at 3 PM and was checked in within a matter of minutes. I opted to self-park my car in the below ground parking garage, and the self-park fee was $23/day. My room had two queen sized beds and I expected it to just bit larger. An easy chair and side table next to the desk left little space between the chair and the bed to navigate to the window and its great view. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. There was wired and wireless internet access available in the room for a $12 or $16 per day additional charge (based on two levels of access). Interestingly, there were video connections on the side of the desk that allowed the user to connect their electronics directly to the flat screen TV in the room. The conference facilities were impressive and met the needs of the organization. The hotel is located about three blocks from many of Indianapolis' great restaurants near Illinois and Maryland streets, and it's connected to the Convention Center and other hotels by the enclosed Skybridge that runs across downtown Indy. It's also just blocks from Lucas Oil Stadium and across the street from Victory Field, the AAA baseball team's home in Indy. My only hiccup at the JW Marriott was that my room key would not open the parking gate on my departure. Unfortunately, there is no attendant at the exit, so I had to run back to the front desk and they quickly gave me a new key to open the gate. A great experience in the end, and I would return for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: awaxy
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a JW before so was looking forward to it. This property is one of the most striking urban hotels I've seen - a gorgeous 33 story monolith! The front desk staff was among the most friendly I've encountered. They make you feel like they are personally thrilled to have you stay with them. They even walk you to the elevators once the check-in is complete. And those elevators are fast! The room is very comfortably furnished - a nice wing-back upholstered chair and a desk chair that gives good support. A bonus - from the upper floors the window by the elevator gives a perfect view into the Indianapolis Indians AAA baseball field. You could watch an entire game from there! Only nits to pick - it is a couple blocks farther from the downtown area than most of the other big hotels. The elevators are arranged in two banks - one for upper floors, one for lower. There was no "crossover" floor, so to get to the Executive Lounge on 31 from my room on 12, I had to first go down to the 4th floor (or lower) and switch banks. The only ice machines are on the 2nd floor, but there are 5 or 6 of them lined up there! But these really are nits. I've stayed at the "regular" Marriott, the Westin, and the Hilton Garden Inn in downtown Indy but I'd rate the JW #1 among those.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ctownhokie
Reviews.Content: Brand new JW Marriott in Indy. Stayed for busines and it was really nice. I expected it to be much nicer than a standard metropolitan Marriott. To me there was very little difference. I have no complaints, just wasn't blown away. Very nice, clean and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: tjbss
Reviews.Content: Excellent "new" luxury hotel with great service, meals, rooms, etc.. Conveniently located to Indiana Convention Center. Expect to pay for parking ($28.00/night), in room internet ($12.95 per 24 hours), $20.00 for breakfast. Etc., etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NormanIL
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. The service was amazing. Each staff member we encountered really made us feel welcomed and invited. We spent a long weekend at this hotel and the lobby is always busy no matter what time of day. As big as the hotel is the pool area was unusually quiet in the morning, which was nice. Location is 10 minutes walking distance to most downtown shopping and dining. The closest CVS/Walgreens is a little farther and closes at 7pm. Parking is convenient but a little high at $28 a day. You need a room key to go up the elevator - it's good for security but can be annoying if everyone in your group doesn't have their own key.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Indy Rocks”
Reviews.Author: LevGonick
Reviews.Content: The amazing JW Marriott is the leading edge of a serious makeover of Indianapolis. Could have sworn I was in an international city with best of class amenities and services. Great welcoming professionals. After checking in I was escorted to the elevators and given a tour of the hotel's restaurants, bars, and other amenities. The hotel room was very clean and the decor and feel was definitely 4 stars. The banquet food was great. The ambiance was first class. And so while Indianapolis has a ways to go in its makeover, the JW Marriott gives the rest of the city a model to follow. Rock On!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ziggity15
Reviews.Content: Amazing new hotel in a great location of downtown Indy. The views from the hotel are great, but by far the hospitality and friendliness of the staff was the best part of the hotel. They bent over backward to help my wife with something. A great hotel, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LLC0325
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at this location twice since it's opening in early 2011 and both visits have been wonderful. From the time you walk in you know you are in someplace special. The staff actually walks out from behind the individual desks to greet you and check you in, and the walks you to the elevators and directs you to your room and amenities. The rooms are beautiful and many feature views of White River park, the baseball field, and the local museums. The hotel is within walking distance of all the local attractions, and if it's a rainy day you can take the covered skywalks to Circle Center Mall. Be sure to check out the fitness center. The exercise bikes feature video screens that are similar to video games where you can track your progress, and the chilled towels (two temperatures are available!) are a great refresher at the end of your workout. The complimentary disposable earbuds are also a nice touch. I've stayed in many locations in Indianapolis including the Westin and the older Marriott, and this is the best by far.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: cjdey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indianapolis JW Marriott for a weekend on our anniversary. With the property being so new I did not know what to expect. The employees were the most helpful and friendly that I have ever run across. I travel for a living and stay at at least 50 hotels per year and was surprised at what I experienced at this property. The Italian restaurant was great and had pricing comperable to local restaurants instead of being overpriced like most hotel restaurants. I look forward to my next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “JW room quality, amenities and service -- some hints on use”
Reviews.Author: aversetospam
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel has created significant excess hotel capacity in downtown Indianapolis. It is better than competing hotels and may be triggering a price war in the area. I booked at $129 with a group discount, a great non-Priceline non-Hotwire price for a hotel of this quality. Location: This hotel is adjacent to the Indianapolis convention center and football stadium and is on the local transit system express shuttle bus route to and from the airport. Suggestion: Take the Indygo Green express from the airport for 7 bucks instead of taking a taxi for $30. If you ask the driver to drop you off across the street from the JW on the way in (at the start of the loop through the city) and catch the shuttle at the JW on the way back (at the end of the loop through the city), the travel time is about the same. Rooms: My room was clean and well furnished with desk/pullout computer table, comfortable chair, large screen TV, and normal amenities coffee/tea, bathroom with tub. Bed was large and comfortable. Suggestion: Request a room facing east for a nice city view and wake up to rising sun. Service and food: The front desk staff was very efficient and helpful. On premises restaurant was slightly overpriced with standard items characteristic of decent convention hotels. Suggestion: If you want to escape from the convention bubble, head one mile to Shapiro’s Deli for classic corned beef on rye, pastrami, matzoball soup and local color. I know – a New York Deli in Indy is not plausible, but this is a local favorite. Or walk a half mile to Palomino’s, a midlevel chain with a mix of items, from local cheeses through standard Italian fare to steaks and seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Great views!”
Reviews.Author: TrickyTK
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic view. Lucky enough to get a corner room and with the floor to ceiling windows the view was spectacular at day and night. Well worth for this reason alone. Service good. Room was very tastefully decorated. Breakfast excellent. A few minor disappointments: had to ask for a second robe twice, wifi was not free as advertised, car parking expensive and there was no fridge in room. These disappointments were far outweighed by the many positives found in this hotel. A great stay. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “indy gem”
Reviews.Author: pounchkee
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Indy! Maybe one of the best hotels anywhere! Service is paramount at this hotel! Travel to Indy for football game and weekend of fun! JW Marriott made the experience even better than expected. Clean well appointed rooms. Great lobby bar, very chic decor.Food in restaurant very good and we were happy that they stayed open after the late nite football game. Great gym in the hotel. Nice feature also, hotel connected to the Skywalk which takes you to almost all other hotels and shopping with out having to go outside . Very nice in inclement weather! Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vg411973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and I would absolutely stay here again when visiting Indy. Rooms are new and clean, bathrooms are oversized. Was in town to see a Colts game and the hotel was buzzing with the visiting team players, and tons of fans. The lobby is comfortable and has a really great bar, plus tons of seating throughout where you can socialize, read or just hang out and people watch. There is a top-notch sports bar also in the hotel lobby (in addition to the lobby bar) and an excellent Italian upscale restaurant that is open for breakfast, lunch, dinner and late-night dinner. All of the meals we had (breakfast, lunch, dinner and Sunday football fare in the Sports Lounge) were terrific. The staff is super-nice. Hotel is walking distance to everything you need to do in Indianapolis, as well as the football Stadium. DO NOT MISS THE BLOODY MARY BAR ON SUNDAY's - for $25, the hotel gives you an awesome Sunday breakfast/brunch plus 3 bloody mary's with a full "make your own bloody mary" bar. The bloody mary bar includes tons of add-ons, including spices, peppers, cheeses, cured meats and shrimp cocktail. It is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in IN!”
Reviews.Author: SUpdike
Reviews.Content: It was clean and modern. Liked the view from the room that I stayed. The staffs are very friendly. I will definitely stay in the Marriott again when I go visit in IN. The best hotel in IN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Denverfoodlover
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful new hotel. Check in was a breeze with a friendly staff. Everyone was so attentive. Our room was on an upper floor with a fantastic view of downtown. The room was spacious and the bathroom had a shower with no bathtub which we loved. The decor was very well done. Breakfast was very good. They have a buffet with everything or you can order off the menu. A great fitness room. Inside walkways are an easy way to get to the mall or other restaurants downtown. Underground parking is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “That's what I am talking about”
Reviews.Author: Laurence31
Reviews.Content: Finally I great hotel that makes sense. Great service, great people, friendly hotel staff willing to make your stay as comfortable as possible.Granted this hotel is relatively new but it really seems to be running on all cyclinders. Restaurants are not bad either considering when it comes to hotel food. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is a decent size. Lovely decor and great views depending on your floor level. This hotel is a winner in my opinion for any road warrior who like myself has particular expectations when away from home. You cannot go wrong by staying at this hotel. I cannot wait to find a way to get back to this property assuming there is no major sporting event in town. Being it is a relatively close to the main football stadium. The hotel is connected by walkways to the major stores and dining places so cold weather should be no issue. Check this place out before the word gets out...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Yayo B
Reviews.Content: I was on indianapolis for business and stayed in the Hotel. Relatively new, very clean, great service and a nice Gym. Only bad thing I could say is that the safe in the room is too small (for a 15" laptop at least)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: rshess
Reviews.Content: I come to the JW for meetings all the time for my job and have always been pleased by the service. Friendly and Efficient. This weekend I took my daughter and her two friends to stay for the night using some points. I was blown away by the service. As soon as they heard we were there for my girl's birthday they kicked it into high gear. This was officially named "Her Best Birthday Ever"- The proximity to shopping, the swimming pool, and room service were big hits. They have the best concierge lounge of any Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: BaldLoonie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a convention for 2 nights. Fast check in, I asked for a high floor room and got 17th, about 1/2 way up. Others in the group were higher without the request. Place wasn't very full. Plenty of people on hand for service. The card in the elevator could be a pain but the elevators were amazing at fast response. I'm with the others about all the extra costs like internet and $28 self park. I couldn't even get a stray wireless from elsewhere. Also got stuck in the garage as my keycard expired later in the day I checked out. Pushed the button on the garage gate and they let me out. Room was nice as would be expected. Not that big but great bed & pillows. Great TV too. Liked the big bathtub, plenty of hot water & pressure. A/C in the room worked great but had low limit of 66 which in realty was about 68. The fan turned on & off constantly all night. I like white noise but not on for a couple off for 5 minutes. I'm surprised there aren't complaints about this. Some, like me, would find it hard to sleep. Room had no bath towels, had to call the office to get them. Another in our group complained to a housekeeper about his room not being cleaned at 5PM. Not sure if he ever got taken care of. Lobby bar was a bit pricey but servers were nice. Didn't go into the sports bar but food prices didn't seem out of line. The Italian joint was good and prices not much above Mac Grill or Olive Garden. I expected it to be steep. Might be a good destination for non hotel guests looking for Italian downtown. Hot tub was hot but didn't bubble as expected. Pool was cool but bearable. Liked the longer hours than many hotels/motels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and walk-friendly area”
Reviews.Author: OOnTheGoOakwoodGA
Reviews.Content: Excellent service began at the front door and continued throughout my stay. Clean, up-to-date, with fantastic view of the White River and the IUPUI campus. From my window, I could see the park and waterfront trails where I ended up walking for miles. What a wonderful surprise to find in Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Vallsw2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and was really shocked at this quality hotel in Indy. It looks like a mini version of the Wynn in Vegas. Very clean and new with great service from the large staff working at the hotel. My room had a great view, very comfortable bed and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ambience, rooms, and staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen32
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and made sure every moment was enjoyable! The rooms are very nice and modern and the lobby decor was amazing. Very unique! The view from our hotel room was great, we could see the whole city. Great stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superior customer service, great property”
Reviews.Author: Coskier303
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay on the property, and it was a long one (5 nights) for a conference. Contrary to other hotels in the other, this property had the room to host the entire conference (3000+ people). During this influx of customers, service never suffered. Wifi stayed operational during the conference (we have melted routers at other hotels), and the food and beverage department provided a great menu (a little agressive at removing plates though). On property restaurants and bars had a great selection of food and drink, and the atmosphere was fun and upbeat. The concierge lounge provided a nice addition to the normal amenities, and gave me a great place to relax with close friends. I hope I can stay at this hotel every time I come to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with all the comforts of home - highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: GetAround43
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott just opened and they didn't miss a beat! From the urban contemporary furnishings to the comforters - this is the place to stay in Indiana. I have stayed twice already and will keep coming back there whenever I am in this fine city. The staff are attentive, courteous and happy to go above and beyond for your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent service”
