Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: Was there with a large conference and despite the pandemonium the conference caused, service was among the best I've experienced. There is plenty of staff; they're friendly, warm and efficient. The hotel is new so everything is still fresh and clean. Bed linens are crisp and immaculate. Lighting in the bathroom is adequate. Water pressure is fine (not fantastic - but above hotel average). My corner room had wonderful unobstructed views.

Reviews.Title: “Indy's Best”
Reviews.Author: JTSHOS
Reviews.Content: Although Indianapolis will not see its Colts in the 2012 Super Bowl, the city is already a huge winner with the addition of this first-class hotel. The JW is in a complex with three other Marriott brand hotels. They share a common parking garage and have access to the new skywalk which makes it possible to walk all the way to Lucas Oil Stadium without ever going outside (by going through the Convention Center). The hotel is a couple of blocks west of the center of downtown, but the skywalk remedies this as you can connect directly to Circle Center Mall as well. Rooms are good sized and well apportioned. The breakfast buffet was very ample with a good selection and well prepared. If you can include this in your package, it is worthwhile as is an upper floor room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing convention space”
Reviews.Author: jwrichte
Reviews.Content: Great attention to detail, good location, great staff

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best in the city of Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: mekgolfski
Reviews.Content: I am a die-hard Marriott loyalist and stay in one of their properties 99% of the time. This property offers exemplary service, quality restaurants, and active and friendly lobby bar and a concierge lounge that is open all day for elite members. The staff can't do enough to make stay comfortable and welcoming from the moment your arrive. The city's sky walk system makes getting from place to place easy regardless of the weather...well worth the few extra dollars for star treatment and qualiity service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luxury1Georgia
Reviews.Content: The new JW Marriott Indianapolis is nice...but not as nice as other JW Marriotts where we have stayed. It is a beautiful hotel but I feel that the Conrad is a more luxurious option in the city. Would I stay there again? Sure, but the conference crowds can be overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: kristenb731
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference for a few days and I cannot say enough good things about this location. They seemed to think of everything - with a 3000 person conference you expect for things to get a little crazy, but everything was seamless from the check in to the check out to the flow of crowds. My room was spacious and had a great view of downtown. Everyone was extremely helpful and overall the service was excellent. If I were ever to return to Indianapolis I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All round great experience”
Reviews.Author: GracemcCarter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a conference. All in all, I was extremely impressed by this hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the room was big and pretty clean, although there was something that looked like a dried up coffee sachet in one corner, that I noticed didn't get cleaned up while I was there. That apart, everything was spotless and brand new. The pool in particular was great, although there was a problem with the temperature on the first day I was there and it was like swimming in a bath! Great views over the city and the lifts were super fast. Only complaint was the aggressive air conditioning - I spent all the daytime freezing cold in the main part of the hotel as I was attending the conference. Can't be helped I suppose, I know a lot of people liked it that temperature but I also spoke to several people who found it too cold as well. Overall though, a very pleasant stay and I would recommend this hotel to other colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities. Gym and pool. Clean!!! Located near good food.”
Reviews.Author: billvog
Reviews.Content: Great facilities. Gym and pool. Clean!!! Located near good food.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: ocdclean
Reviews.Content: Great stay at JW Marriott. Room was brand new, spotless, stylish and comfortable. Customer service at check-in was excellent and restaurant had delicious food especially liked the breakfast buffet, service was good. Hotel was so convenient to attend a conference as JW had a connecting walkway to Indi convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Value”
Reviews.Author: RCcruiser999
Reviews.Content: Never been to Indy and didn't know what to expect but for sure the JW Marriott was a difference maker. Very close to downtown restaurants, Lucas Oil Stadium, museums, zoo, parks...most in walking distance. New hotel with the a Starbucks on premise, sports bar, upscale Italian restaurant and a super reasonable buffet breakfast. Comfortable beds and generally quiet except for the occasional emergency vehicle sirens (Fire station just a block away). Staff was friendly and helped us score some tickets for a sold out event. Would stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mick342
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW this past weekend. Stayed on the 19th floor. We had a great view overlooking the city. Beds were very nice. Nice fluffy towels. Staff went out of their way to find me some bandaids also...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Great friendly hotel with good service. Somewhat pricey, valet is $32 a day, so that adds up. Breakfast buffet is a good value and is quick. Would recommend checking that out. Most annoying thing is that there are no ice machines on the guest floors.... that sucks.

Reviews.Title: “5th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Crashdavis95
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. We had a corner room on the 26th floor and had windows alll around. Well worth the money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: nycstella
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully constructed new hotel with excellent staff. The room was a good size, very clean and had a nice view of the city (with a park view on the other side of the hotel). My luggage had been lost and I had stupidly checked my phone charger in my luggage and my phone was about to die. The front desk raided their stash of chargers and when they couldn't find a match, the offer to have another Marriott in town bring over a charger for me. I didn't venture anywhere for dinner and just ordered room service. It was "okay". I did head down the the restaurant for breakfast and there was an impressive breakfast buffet with all the usuals, plus waffles and omelettes. It was on the expensive side, but the food was surprisingly good! I had some time to kill before leaving Indianapolis and the concierge desk was very helpful at offering ideas and directions to things to do in the area. I would recommend this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “My engagement was so romantic at The J.W. Marriott”
Reviews.Author: cheydogger
Reviews.Content: I got engaged at The J.W. Marriott this past weekend. Everything was so nice. The arrangements between my finacee and the hotel were done exactly as asked. We were acknowledged by the staff throughout our stay and made to feel like royalty. I couldn't have asked for a better proposal site. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is really nice. We had a room that overlooked Victory Field and Lucas Oil Stadium to our south and the zoo and IMAX to the west. The restaurant is pretty good too:) The location of this hotel is superb. I definitely give it the 5 star rating! We look forward to another stay in the future. This hotel does not have a spa, but it does have two massage rooms. I didn't enjoy my massage as much as I could have because the radio was broken, so we had to listen to kids screaming in the pool area and people talking in the hall during our massage . The massage itself was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service..charge too much for extras”
Reviews.Author: Russia99
Reviews.Content: We stayed one nite in Sept2011... Its is a fantastic Hotel with all the amenities you would expect... customer service is fantastic!!! However they charge too much for extras... $ 28.00 each day to park or $ 32.00 for valet parking.. $ 13.00 for WIFI...$12.95 to rent a movie plus $ 3.00 in tax... They charge enough for the rooms.. they certailny dont need to tack on all the extra fees on top of it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "Wow!"”
Reviews.Author: SpaChick2
Reviews.Content: This is the best Marriott hotel I have ever stayed in and am a frequently traveler. From the moment you arrive, you receive top-notch service. My room was on the 31st floor and had a gorgeous view of the rivew, baseball stadium, and aquarium. Wonderful concierge lounge with great views and good food. The decor is beautiful. Every detail has been considered. Staff is A+. Location is excellent. Connected corridor to mall and restaurants around the convention center. Even though the price is high, you get your money's worth. The only con: parking is way too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: sammyj18
Reviews.Content: While in town for the motogp, we decided to splurge and stay here. Location is good close to some nice parks and restaurants. Bar was excellent, beds comfortable. Very clean, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “simply divine”
Reviews.Author: cosmicblight
Reviews.Content: This is simply the best hotel I have ever been to. The service is impeccable. When we arrived the first time the front desk asked if we had been there before we said no, and he walked us to the elevators. I requested a high floor and what I got was simply perfect. From the room on the 22nd floor we had a gorgeous view of downtown Indy including the Lucas oil stadium. From the floor near the elevator we had a great view of the canal and white river statepark. I really did not expect this hotel to be as grand as the Conrad Chicago but far surpasses any of my expectations. Even my small request were met with promptness. I had requested a plastic fork and also a cell phone charger (25 deposit). What was also really accomadating is on our next arrival I requested the same room for the amazing views and it was granted.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: mgminstrell
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference hosted in the hotel and stayed 4 nights in conjunction. Rooms have a great view, comfortable with all amenities needed. Quick elevators, convenient to get to/from rooms, meeting rooms, and lobby/businesses. Great variety of lobby restaurant choices. Excellent downtown location, can walk to anything needed, including minor league ball park across the street (or watch the game through the conference area windows!). Take the IndyGo green shuttle from airport for only $7. No problems with housekeeping service, front desk staff and concierge very friendly. Organizing meeting rooms was not as smooth as desired. Would certainly stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: frodo55Marion_IN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW last weekend. Celebrated our anniversary and saw a Colts game. The hotel's location is one of the best in the city. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the staff were all helpful and friendly. The cost wad also extremely good. We will most definitely stay again. Overall an excellent hotel with a super breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, close to everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Huskyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a last family summer outing before our son went back to school. We loved the hotel, the hospitality is unmatched. Everyone was friendly and helpful, they almost answered your question before you asked it! We will most definitely stay here the next time we visit Indy!! The room views were incredible, the beds were comfortable & the room had pretty much every ammenity you could want. Plus there was no annoying window air conditioner to deal with. The Children's Museum and the Indianapolis Zoo are very close, the zoo is close enough to walk to. Victory Field is right next door & depending on which side of the hotel you're on you could watch a game from your room.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: french4us
Reviews.Content: JW is awesome!! Service from check in til check out was great! Front desk was so nice and very informative. Our room was comfy and clean - we had a great view of the city! Concierge was great in recommending and making reservatuions for us at a local restaurant and a comedy club. Hotel food and service was again - great!!! We would definatly recommend this hotel for any occassion! So much to do with walking distance!!! We hope to be beack next time in INDY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khk2011
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is clean and safe. That is what I always check for first when booking a hotel. The location is great, pretty much right downtown. We had a wedding to attend at the Indiana State Musuem so this hotel was perfect for that. The outside of the hotel and the lobby are both lovely. The rooms are very modern and nice (although nothing overly spectacular). My only real complaint is that I requested a King bed in March, our stay was the end of July, and we didnt get the bed. Not a huge deal, but it was important to me and I had requested it so far in advance that I was really disappointed that they couldn't give us the bed we had asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: thetravelczarina
Reviews.Content: This new property is in the middle of downtown Indianapolis, across from the Convention Center and the Indiana Indians ball field. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms had plenty of space. Prices for restaurant food and room service was very reasonable, which was a pleasant surprise. The breakfast buffet had plenty of delicious options, including eggs/omelets made to order. We never expected this upscale Marriott hotel to have affordable food. There was also a Starbucks kiosk in the hotel. The only thing that was disappointing was that the hotel was very humid. Our room was on the 25th floor and the hallway was extremely warm and humid, as if it does not get ventilated. The temperature in the room itself could be set down to 66 degrees but it never got cooler than 70 degrees. That is pretty typical for all new hotels these days. If you like sleeping in a cool room, stay in an older hotel. Regardless, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: akmmba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott with our 12-year-old son for an event at the very nearby Lucas Oil Stadium. We checked in at 2:00 in the morning and were greeted warmly by a team of 2 or 3 front desk staff. The lobby was large and spotless and we saw lots of amenities along the way to our elevator. Our room (2 queens) was really beautiful. Brand new, gorgeous large bathroom, modern, and even an iPod dock on the alarm clock between the two beds. The beds were comfy and the heavy drapes kept out all of the sun as we slept in the next morning. We found a note from the front desk staff slipped under our door in the morning when we woke up. They noticed how excited we were that there was a brand new Starbucks right in the building (hey, we're from Seattle), and so they gave us a card for a free drink! Now that's service! We didn't use the fitness center, but we walked though it and it was modern and gorgeous. Lots of great equipment, light, and space. We all felt very at home at the Marriott and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: sayhi2tinee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights for a conference. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable - I had a nice view of downtown Indy. Other rooms had a great view of the baseball field. Fitness Center was great - had plenty of treadmills, elliptical machines, weights, etc. Concierge Lounge was the best part of the hotel -- enjoyed the free breakfast and afternoon snacks. They even had desserts in the evenings! Downsides - no ice machines on each floor - you had to call Guest Services or go to the second floor. I felt silly having to call someone to get me ice, so I didn't do it. Having to pay for wifi in my room. I wish Marriott and some of the higher priced chains would just give free Internet access - or at the very least offer it free to Marriott Rewards members.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Carync6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with modern decor and a perfect location. It is next to te White River park, museums, NCAA builing and Victory field. The bar is nice. The only complaint was a request for a rollaway. I was there for three nights and needed a roll away bed for the last night. I requested the bed at check in and the clerk said no problem. However, the third day when I went to confirm the bed request, I was told that with two queen beds they were not allowed to give me one due to a fire hazard. The extra person had to sleep on the floor. Without this issue, I would have provided a 5star rating across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service by Caring, Energetic Employees”
Reviews.Author: jottoson
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at the JW Marriott in Indianapolis for a business conference. Upon arriving on a bus from the airpoirt, was greeted by bell staff. Walked into the lobby where there were at least 10 front desk people standing in front of the front desk to assist. She promptly escorted me to the check in counter. As a Marriott platinum inquired about a possible suite upgrade and was given a corner suite on the 26th floor with amazing views. I was not just given the keys and told were the elevators were, I was escorted to the elevators, she inserted the key and pressed my floor. (i have had experiences like this before, but usually at a Ritz Carlton or St Regis, never at a convention hotel) So far I have interacted with about 8 team members for the hotel, all who are always smiling and very courteous. I have easily stayed about 1000 nights in a hotel over the past ten years. Of all of those experiences, never have I experienced the most consistent high level of service throughout a property, that I have at the JW Marriott Indianapolis. Obviously this property has high standards influenced by a very effective management team. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “JW did not disappoint...you really can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: NaptownChica
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here this past weekend (Aug 13-15) and had a wonderful time. We were in room 3101 and had a fantastic view. Tip: if you get this room, you will not be disappointed. The JW Indy is the tallest hotel in Indianapolis and depending upon which way you are facing, the views are incredible. We ate at High Velocity only and chose to walk to the many other restaurants in the area. The executive lounge is very nice on the 31st floor but my tip is to make sure that you don’ t wait until breakfast is almost over to get there. The breakfast ended at 11am but by 10:45 or so, a lot of the food was gone. The staff there did make a special trip to replenish what was there but if you had an appointment to make, you would have been late. Pros: - Check-in: was a breeze. It was quick and came off without a hitch. - The convenience: This hotel is close to everything in downtown Indy. You can take the skywalk to the convention center and on down to the mall. You are in walking distance of several restaurants, Indiana State House, and the canal – where you can rent paddle boats. You do not need a car if you are staying downtown. - The rooms: very clean and nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. The shower had 2 “body” shower heads coming out of the wall in addition to the main one from above – nice touch! - The staff: was very nice and willing to go the extra mile if you needed anything. We ordered extra towels and did not have to wait long for them. - The food: we ate at High Velocity and the Executive lounge (for breakfast). Overall, the food was pretty good but I would recommend that you venture out – there is so much more to offer downtown. Executive “breakfast” included scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, a daily chef’s special (biscuits and gravy), juice, muffins, lox and cream cheese bagels, etc. For more economic options, Friday’s is located on the property just behind (west of) the hotel. Cons: - The rooms: they were a bit small and there was no refrigerator or safe. But I believe the smaller rooms are so that the hotel can accommodate for more rooms. Overall, I didn’t feel cramped but I have stayed at Marriott’s where the rooms were bigger. - Capacity to hold groups: My only other issue is whether this hotel has the full capacity to accommodate groups. My husband’s fraternity had its centennial celebration in Indy last month. The JW Marriott was one of the host hotels. Unfortunately, it had to “close” down the lobby and hotel because it was too crowded. The closing did pose a problem for some people downtown. I am quite sure the JW left a lot of money on the table that night! Nevertheless, if this was a problem then, I can’t imagine how they will handle the Super bowl! - The Pool: is very small (approximately 25 ft long) and only about 4 ½ feet. - Executive Lounge: they ran out of food close to the end of breakfast. It also seemed like they let almost “anyone” in there. I can see how someone could just “sneak” in behind someone. That said, the staff did go and get more to replenish.

Reviews.Title: “this is a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reesie42
Reviews.Content: The location for our purposes was perfect---event at Lucas Stadium. Staff helpful, rooms well appointed, decor of common areas elegant but welcoming, variety of restaurants. This is a top notch hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by”
Reviews.Author: AnneU1121
Reviews.Content: I have visited many JW Marriott properties around the world and was excited when I learend one would be built in Indianapolis as I travel there frequently. I've been a Marriott Rewards member for years and always try to choose a Marriott property if one is available. Check in was easy and the front desk staff was extremely helpful. Overall I was impressed by the professionalism and attentiveness of the staff until I checked out. About 30 minutes after departing I realized I left something in the room. I contacted the hotel and was advised I would be contacted when housekeeping turned in the item. I was never contacted and called back four more times over the course of the day until I reached someone who sent an employee to the room to retrieve the item. Unfortunately the item was not in the room. The employee advised they checked all areas the item may have been turned in without luck. I was advised an internal investigation would be conducted and a claim report was filed. I was also advised I would be contacted in reference to the claim report but again have yet to be contacted. I realize leaving the item behind was my own fault but am deeply disappointed by the dishonesty of the JW Marriott staff and the failure to turn the item in to lost and found as I was advised is their policy. This is not what I have come to expect from a JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Stumped by all the love for this mediocre convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertaAnthony
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled. While this nice, new, clean JW is a cool addition to the Indy skyline, it comes nowhere near most JWs in terms of service, style, vibe, and clientele. If however you don't mind a massive 1000-plus room beehive, 45-minute or more wait for breakfast (for the buffet!), completely below par executive lounge on the Concierge level, and grating masses clamoring through the lobby, then this place is for you. We arrived at 8 pm with three large bags and two roll-a boards yet there was no bellman in sight nor did any staff offer to find one or welcome us. As we dragged our bags once more, this time down the long long hallway to our room, we noticed a piece of white paper folded into the door jam of most every room, including, finally, ours. Turned out to be a crassly worded edict to guests informing us that the hotel had several big events coming in the next morning, Sunday, so could we please be sure to be out by 11! What a welcome. Hello - now leave! Don't mind a gentle reminder, but as a Marriott Elite I have earned and am accustomed to flexible check out. This memo certainly could have been written less offensively, or not posted at all to certain rooms. Further with the wait for breakfast so long, as we learned the hard way the next morning, how on earth do they expect you to hustle out? Given the long and winding line for the brunch buffet, we checked out the concierge lounge on the 31st floor, which also serves breakfast. What a mess. Upon arrival - they were out of coffee. Dirty dishes, leftovers scattered all over the room. The buffet/serve-yourself area was filthy - as was every piece of purportedly clean silverware. We finally assembled some plates and utensils, (which we had to wipe down) only to open the lid of the "scrambled eggs" buffet dish and learn that was empty too. Server said several times they were on the way with more, but no eggs ever arrived. We cobbled together sort of a fake lox and bagels out of what remained of the sliced salmon, left over low fat cream cheese - the regular was gone - and a piece of wheat bread, as only one bagel - raisin- remained in the bin. The pastry selection was better, but they did not taste fresh. Later, trying to make a cup of hot tea, we were greeted with no hot water. Finally got the water from a server who went to the kitchen for us, but as we went back to the tea/coffee set up we found there were no creamers or stirrers. Asked for a stirrer, a server digs one out of the back of a cabinet and hands it to us, unwrapped with his bare hands. All in all atrocious. This is a herd 'em in, herd 'em out convention hotel and nothing more. Maybe a nice addition for this city and convenient to The Colts and Indy 500, but if you are looking for fine service, class and luxury, this is not it. Really wanted to give this property 2 1/2 stars but since there is no half option, I went for the three. But it really isn't even that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DLEHMAN230
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for the weekend when we came to Indy to see the DCI World Championships. What a beautiful hotel! I expected as much being a part of the JW series. I loved the underground parking and also how the parking garage was color coded to let you know where you needed to go. Check-in was super easy & the young woman at the front desk walked us to the elevator and explained all the hotel restaurants & other details we might want to know. Our room was perfect! It was clean, well-stocked, & had everything we possibly could want in a hotel room. We did however hit a snafu with ordering room service. It took us about an hour & a half at about 1:00 a.m. to get our room service order, but the hotel was great in making it up to us by deducting our room service bill by 50% since the food was delivered warm & was actually very tasty. This by no means hurt my rating on this hotel! We had breakfast in Osterio Pronto, and it was pretty good. The hotel overall was very nice, clean, the staff was very accomodating, and the decor was just gorgeous! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business and leisure resort-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: LEB71
Reviews.Content: Fabulous building and service make it my favorite Marriott right now. Only detraction is the pool which is small if bringing a family. Lobby has a Manhattan-buzz every evening I've been there.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever! Good location in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: jaminwi
Reviews.Content: Every single staff was extremely nice and helpful. Food was amazing. Very nice and new. Fast elevators. The only negative would be room size was a little on the small size.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel with an Upscale feel”
Reviews.Author: Kjasie
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to learn that I would be staying at the brand new JW Marriott while on business in Indianapolis. The hotel was beautiful, the service was wonderful, and best of all the hotel connects directly to the convention center. I ate in the restaurant multiple times and ordered room service and each time my food was amazing. The room was clean and modern, and best of all you received free internet and bottled water daily.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling & Vibrant city spot”
Reviews.Author: MrsLauderdale
Reviews.Content: Great service from Valet, Lobby bellman and concierge staff. Beautiful decor everywhere. Very clean and modern. There was an issue with room temperature staying comfortable. The fancy restaurant in the hotel was very disappointing. They got my kid's order wrong and then delivered a dish that was inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: chflounder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during the Brickyard. What a great find. The hotel was very clean, and the staff could not have been friendlier. Our room was well furnished and very comfortable. We asked for a refrigerator at check in, and they promptly brought one to our room. Hard to find this at most hotels (at no charge). The sports bar near the lobby has great food, and at reasonable prices. We ate there 2X and had no complaints. Great tap beer selection as well. Kudos to the bell staff. They were on top of everything we needed. Furthermore, we got into a cab one morning and the driver tried to gouge us on the fare to the track (double the price). I immediatley got out of the cab and informed the bell staff at the door. They promptly took care of the matter and kicked him out of the lot. At any rate, we would stay here again in a minute. The only thing I wish they would change is the price of internet access. Most places throw this in now days.

Reviews.Title: “TOP OF THE LINE WINNER FOR MARRIOTT.....WOW!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyKouple
Reviews.Content: As Marriott Vacation Club owners, we routinely stay in Marriott resorts and use our points to stay in Marriott hotels when we travel and are always pleased. BUT....we decided to do a little Friday night getaway and stay in the new JW Marriott in downtown Indy last night. UNBELIEAVABLE! We were on the 33rd floor, top of the hotel with a perfect view of Lucas Oil Stadium (home of the Super Bowl this year) and couldn't believe the beautiful hotel's amenities. The executive lounge was all decked out for the Brickyard 400 and the buffet in the Pronto restaurant downstairs was just awesome. This is the largest JW Marriott in the world....over 1000 rooms....and we'll be back. Just spectacular! Good job Marriott!! (NOTE: $28 to park is a bit steep and no real pool to speak of)

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: ksfmom
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW! What an incredible experience…and that’s what this hotel is – an experience! From the moment we pulled into the very modern entrance drive to the time we checked out, we were astonished by the level of service we received from every staff member we encountered. We have had the opportunity to stay at most of the downtown hotels including the Conrad, the Westin, the Marriott, and the Hyatt, and I can truly say that in our short stay at the JW Marriott, they have made us customers for life! First of all, the building itself is a knock-out – contemporary and sleek...a beautiful addition to the Indianapolis skyline. The lobby was bustling with activity at all hours, and although we didn’t have the chance to visit any of the restaurants, they looked very inviting - especially the lobby bar which had plenty of cozy areas for drinks and conversation. The design is one in which there is no congestion. Even though there were many people passing through, the flow of traffic was smooth...just one more indication of the many details that have gone into designing this hotel. Although it was quite busy when we checked in around 8:00 pm, we had no wait. All the check-in desks were busy, but as soon as we stepped into the waiting area, a gentleman who had been observing the lobby area came to greet us and take us to another check-in station. We appreciated his attentiveness, but were even more impressed with his personalized service. We were informed that as Marriott Reward members, we had been upgraded to one of the higher floor rooms, and believe me, the view is incredible! When he asked the purpose of our visit, we explained that we were celebrating our daughter’s 21st birthday. He immediately focused on her, wishing her a happy birthday and giving her the “royal treatment.” He then proceeded to ask her if she had a favorite wine, as he wished to send up a complimentary bottle in honor of her special day. What a thoughtful touch! Then, instead of just issuing our keys and pointing us in the direction of the elevators, he escorted us to the bank of elevators that we would be using to reach our floor…just one more little detail to make you feel truly welcome. We liked the added security of having to use your room key to activate the ability to press the floor button, a feature you don’t see very often. The room itself was comfortable, well-appointed, and visually appealing. A variety of colors and textures were used to create a space that was just different enough from most upscale hotel chains to make it really stand out. Although we were not in the room much on this little get-away, I am looking forward to going back and spending time at the hotel to take in all they have to offer. If you are heading to Indianapolis, whether it be for business or pleasure, I would highly recommend staying at the JW Marriott. By the way, even though we were in town during the time that the Brickyard 400 was being run, the rates we secured (via the hotel Website) were better than those offered by most of the other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A truly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithPrJim
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever seen. I had occasion to spend three days there while attending a training event. The hotel was at the same time elegant, functional, efficient, and friendly. I was barely inside the door when a hotel clerk approached me and led me to a check-in desk. Formalities completed in a few seconds, I was on my way to my well-appointed and comfortable room overlooking the stadium of the Indianapolis Indians baseball team. It's a shame there wasn't a home game during my stay. I had thought I would need to pay extra for the high-speed internet, but it ended up being included in my room rate. The hotel catered all the meals for the event I was attending. The food and service were uniformly superb. My special request for vegetarian meals was honoured with no difficulty whatsoever. Food service was proper and efficient, but also warm and friendly. Our meeting spaces were excellent and user-friendly, with audio-visual equipment that worked flawlessly. Several times I needed to make use of the hotel concierge, who had the information I needed immediately at hand. I would give the JW Marriott the highest marks. The hotel is well-equipped to handle business conferences and conventions. I look forward to my next trip to Indianapolis to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New, stylish, comfy and clean!!”
Reviews.Author: mpenny
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the JW Marriott on the way to a big family reunion. We found a great deal for this hotel on Priceline! Anyway, the hotel was easy to find, parking was cheap ($6/ day) for a major city and the hotel is right across the street from a museum and a big park. The hotel itself is modern in style and guest services (touch screen lobby directory and free wifi). The rooms were very clean, the towels and linens were soft. What I did not like is that the ice machine was on the 2nd floor, and staying on the 14th floor, we found that inconvenient. Also, in order to use the internet service IN the business center I had to pay. 40 cents/min. Other than those things, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But here are a couple of things.....”
Reviews.Author: BillyHope
Reviews.Content: This hotel's decor was top notch. The beds and baths in the room were excellent. The only complaint i have is that in July when it was 90+ degrees out the lobby and the elevators seemed to lack air flow...very stuffy. Also the thermostat in the room didnt seem to work but we may have just had a faulty one. All the amenities in this asian styled decor ladened hotel seemed to be top o the line and i would love to stay at a hotel like this anytime i traveled. definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: harry_Philly
Reviews.Content: Very well furnished rooms, full functional internet service and great food options on site. If I didn't have all my points on Starwood, I'd stay here every time!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JeffFIndy
Reviews.Content: This is a great new and exciting hotel. Highly recommend staying here for conventions and downtown business. Rooms are beautiful but just average in size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjandljtravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the fairly new JW Marriott in Indianapolis in mid-July. We normally stay at the Conrad what visiting Indy but decided to try out the new hotel. The hotel is over-sized - probably 5X the size of the Conrad. Almost reminds one of a Vegas-style hotel. The styling of the hotel is very modern/eclectic - it stands in sharp contrast to the more conservative and traditional Conrad styling. I personally prefer the Conrad but I'm sure others will prefer the JW. The JW lobby is loud and busy - Conrad is quiet and reserved. The service was generally pretty good - however, the luggage did take over 30 minutes to get to the room. I finally went down stairs to retrieve the luggage at which point the bell man brought it up. We did not order room service or eat at the restaurants so we got little exposure to the service other than the valet, which was fine. The room view was spectacular. We were on the top floor and had an end room - two walls with floor to ceiling glass. Amazing. This is one area that the Conrad can not complete with JW - the views. Otherwise, the room was like the lobby - more modern in design. The office chair looks like something from my parents 70's kitchen. Take note: the bathroom does NOT have a tub - least not in our room. Also, the room did not have a couch (which you get at the Conrad) although there is room for one. But overall the room was very nice, beds were comfortable. The pool is very small - smaller than Conrad and I do not like the "raised" design of the pool. Hot tub was nice sized and the excerise facility was very large. One area where the Conrad is obviously superior to the JW is the changing/shower facilities for the pools and excercise rooms. There is no comparison. Conrad feels like an exclusive golf club with dry/wet sauna, multiple showers, many free amenities etc. The JW feels like a public changing area with no saunas and few free amenities. The Conrad comes equipped with robes and they are nowhere in sight at the JW. The presence of a Starbucks in the meetings area is a nice feature. Overall, the new JW is a great new hotel in Indy but my vote is still that Conrad is a distant first. If you are an executive used to high-end treatment, it's my opinion the JW probably will not quite satisfy like the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aeowyn98
Reviews.Content: This new hotel in Indianapolis by far exceeded my expectations. Beautiful hotel, professionally designed modern facilities and rooms. Abundant, helpful, and very friendly staff! Rooms were superb! Clean in every corner, comfortable bed, amazing view of the city from the floor to ceiling wall size windows! (I was on the 24th floor), flat screen Samsung TV in the rooms, room service, video checkout. Hotel was a short walking distance from the State Museum and the Eiteljorg Museum (both worth seeing) and Fridays restaurant. On site restaurant and bar/cocktail lounge. The cities sky-walk also connected to the hotel making it convenient to get around the city and avoid traffic. I would love to come back to this hotel for a longer stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lining”
Reviews.Author: ExpertComptable
Reviews.Content: A conference rate and a satisfactory room but too many clouds! Ridiculously expensive add-ons for Internet (12.95), parking (27.00), and breakfast (20.00+) made me feel cheated and colleagues from abroad just plainly surprised that a quality hotel would be so money grubbing. The staff were cheerful and very helpful and considerate, but frankly a $200 a night hotel should avoid excessive add-on overcharging. Quality hotels in today's world need to be up front with charges.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic with just one (tiny) exception; best service anywhere”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyPilgrim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the J.W. Marriott in Indianapolis for three nights during a national conference. Was one of the best hotel stays of my life. Rooms are clean and new, well designed and decorated, and the conference facilities are fantastic. Absolute best of all is the staff. This hotel has done some outstanding work in training its staff to be friendly, attentive and helpful to guests. You could not pass a staff member without being greeted with a friendly smile and hello, and often with an offer to help with anything needed. Truly remarkable level of customer service. My only criticism is that during my staff something was amiss with the ventilation system in the parking garage. The dryers from the laundry were venting directly into the parking garage and when we left after three days our car was covered with a blanket of dryer lent. It was stinky and gross, not at all consistent with the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Busy atmosphere but personable employees”
Reviews.Author: Miriam_F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a weekend where a big conference was just ending. The hotel and Indianapolis were overrun with people. However, the staff at the hotel still helped us to feel welcome and provided for our needs with a warm welcome upon check-in to suggestions as to where I might find a chocolate chip cookie after midnight. The room was clean and the shower was great. There are two spray heads located about 2 feet lower from the shower head to envelop you in water.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis for my Weary Traveler's Soul”
Reviews.Author: paul2one2
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of staying here the week immediately following their grand opening. I had been on a pretty long run, 4 consecutive weeks on the road, and was feeling it. Something about this place just lifted my spirits shortly after check-in and I've only found it to continue to impress the more times I've stayed (4x times since). The rooms are great, well appointed and modern. What I really like is the lounge, which I understand is the top one in the entire JW system. Jen and Natalie are excellent hosts and very pleasant and actually knowledgeable travelers themselves. The location isnt right in the middle of downtown but close enough. Have an upscale restaurant, a nice elegant bar and a sports bar & grill all in the lobby as well. Everything one needs. This is my favorite hotel in the Midwest and the only one I stay in now in Indy (So long Westin!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Accomodations and Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpike34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Indianapolis as well as other locations and the JW Marriott here in Indy is probably my favorite hotel. Every staff member I have encountered on numerous stays has been friendly and knowledgeable. The check in and out process is smooth and efficient. Rooms are modern with attractive decor, all of the rooms I have stayed in have a comfortable lounge chair, desk chair and plenty of outlets. Next to the bed there are reading lights. The king sized rooms have shower only while the rooms with two beds have a large shower with glass door. If you like watching videos you have ordered online you can plug your PC into the HDTV and view it on the TV, love that! The concierge lounge is available to Marriott Gold & Platinum members, they serve a really great variety of hors d'oeuvres and have an honor bar with an excellent selection of beer, wine and liquor. Soft drinks, bottled water, sparkling water etc. are available all day. The breakfast is simply outstanding, the best I've had in any concierge lounge anywhere. The staff in the lounge is top notch, they will make an effort to get to know you and take care of your needs. The hotel has two dining options, three during warm weather months as they open a restaurant on the back patio. All have good food and are not ridiculously overpriced as in many hotel restaurants. Room service is also delicious. Housekeeping at the JW Indy is exceptional, not only do they make the bed and replace toiletries but all your shoes will be lined up if you leave any out, bathroom toiletries will be left arranged, it's just a nice job. Please tip them accordingly. Valet service is uneven, although it has improved recently. The staff is very courteous but you should call down from your room 5 minutes or so before you need your car during busy times. If there is a big convention or event perhaps longer. The hotel fitness center is really great if you like to keep in shape while traveling. Great selection of machines, free weights, cardio etc. and the view is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Cudos...handling large crowd while taking care of us”
Reviews.Author: rlhjlh
Reviews.Content: Arriving downtown Indianapolis after long drive, all we wanted was good meal, comfortable and quite room...and a bit of a humdrum. Pulling into the JW Marriott was anything but quiet--there was a huge national fraternity convention there--thousands of folks milling about...out first thought was, 'we are really screw.....d" The Lobby was so loud that we had to shout our names to the registration desk...that is after we had worked with the outside valets and such to get our bags out of the car.... we finally got registered...went to room...bags got there with seconds... Room was refreshing, bright, and tasteful. We loved it. We only hoped that it would be soundproof--because Saturday night--convention night--was not going to be a silence night... So, we did the chin up..and head back down to the restaurant.. where we were told there would be a 15 minute wait...we were escorted to the "Tavern on the Plaza--had a pleasant drink--and then the folks from Osteria Pronto came to get us for dinner.... After dinner--headed back to room...and collapsed... did not hear another thing until late inthe morning....check out went okay, given the thousands of folks doing the same thing at the same time.... but the Staff and JW handled it professionally. All in all...a good evening...and comfortable night... would recommend this over anything that claims to be a 'motel" along the highway... ON downside: big hotel..charges for internet...and parking....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but kind of cold...”
Reviews.Author: SouthernSweetT
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property. Just not to my personal taste, as it felt cold and hard to me. Having said that, all employees were exceptionally helpful and pleasant. The room was spacious, with a glass wall window overlooking the park. Glorious evening sunsets from the bed!!! Beware - the windows "pop and crack" which is kind of unnerving the first time you hear it - sounds like the wall is going to blow out! The location is on the edge of downtown, so any restaurant/coffee house is at least a two block walk. It is right across from two museums, with easy access to the canal (lovely area to walk), and on the other side of the building is Victory field for those who enjoy baseball. Parking costs more at this location than at other "name" hotels just a couple of blocks away - as much as $10 more per night - but if you don't mind walking, you don't have to use a car. Internet available for a price. All in all, lovely area with kind employees. I'm just more of the "warm and cozy" type.

Reviews.Title: “Well done! JW Marriott Indi”
Reviews.Author: leelee_gsu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and staff is wonderful. The rooms are decorated very tastefully. I had a great dinner at the Italian restaurant in the hotel. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. The bathroom is really nice with a large glass shower. two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Beautiful Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ohshoozannah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a conference. The staff was friendly, attentive and professional. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Indianapolis area. The hotel restauarants were amazing, especially the Italian one, although the name escapes me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaChicago
Reviews.Content: The new JW Marriott was a perfect place for a weekend getaway. The design and quality of the hotel far exceeds anywhere I have ever stayed at in Indy. We checked into the hotel on a very busy Friday evening. There was a convention in the hotel plus a baseball game right next door. Even with the events and people, we were still greeted like VIP and able to sail through the check in process with no issues at all. Our room was on a high floor and even though our view did not face downtown, the view out over the baseball field and zoo/park/river areas were quite beautiful. Our room was very well appointed, comfortable, and clean. No complaints at all. We utilized the fitness center and were extremely satisfied with the quality of the facility – cold towels, bottles of water, and wonderful views from all the machines. We visited the main lobby bar for some pre-dinner cocktails and thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance and drinks. I would highly recommend St. Elmo Steakhouse for dinner which is an easy walk from the hotel. I would also recommend checking out if the Indianapolis Indians have a home baseball game and if the weather is nice, take a walk over to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JennHenz
Reviews.Content: I'm obsessed with clean hotels and sometimes I don't get a lot of sleep worrying about bugs. Not at the JW Marriott. The room was spotlessly clean and still smelled new. The hosts were very helpful. The room service was pricey so we opted for High Velocity - one of the restaurants at the hotel that was open later. It was delicious and reasonably priced. I'd probably find the hotel to be too expensive if we hadn't gotten such a good deal online. Overall, this place was super clean, super comfortable, and very much worth it.

Reviews.Title: “3rd trip and it was even better than the first 2”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousIllinois
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel. I dont travel alot for business but when I do I try to stay in better hotels as I like to be comfortable and dont want to stress about things. This hotel always meets those expectations and this visit in particular. Everyone here is very friendly and helpful - even doing something minor such as giving me toothpaste which I forgot rather than having me buy it in their little store area. It was raining and they offered me an umbrella without me asking. It is stuff like that that sets this hotel apart from others, including its sister hotels in the immediate area. If you have a chance to stay on one of the upper floors, do so. I was on the 33rd/top floor and the views, particularly at night were incredible. I will definitely be coming back to his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, new hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: The_Gibson
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four days in late May, 2011. The room was great, the staff was great, and the thermostat worked well. Everything was very clean and very fresh. I only gave it four stars due to the fluctuation of the room costs and the high cost of parking. I needed it again next week, but the room rate fluctuated up $150+. Give it a try...

Reviews.Title: “A great big ship still on the shakedown cruise”
Reviews.Author: vincenzopwd
Reviews.Content: This is a huge JW. 1,000 rooms. This means the lobby is busy at times and somewhat chaotic. It is a beautiful hotel with great views from the rooms. Nice rooms of a fair size for a city hotel. Concierge lounge is open seven days a week and busy. Now the negative. It is a new hotel and the bugs are not worked out of it yet. Great 40” HDTV with actually HD picture – when it works. Clearly some bugs to work out – staff was aware. We went the first 90+ degree days for this hotel and it was hot. The “green” HVAC for the room does not work when you are out of the room. This means that when you get back from that 90 degree weather outside the room was 74.9 degrees. Place the thermostat at 66 and it will get down to 71. The king bed was hard and the shower has a drain that is a good ¼” from the tile—you hit is constantly. Parking is expensive -$28.00 self Overall it’s a great hotel that is still getting out the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: kbeeker
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Great view from 32nd floor. Large room and very comfortable. Very good Concierge Lounge. Self parking is a little high at 28.00 per night. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome getaway”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of nights in the new JW Marriott this weekend and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Pros: Our room on the 32nd floor was large, comfortable, and very clean. There are staff members everywhere, eager to be of service. The concierge lounge was wonderful. I was appreciative of the security - a room key is required to get the elevator to go to the guest floors. The exercise area rivals most full service gyms. Skywalks connect the JW Marriott all the way to the Circle Center Mall, the convention center, most of the largest hotels downtown, and Lucas Oil Stadium. The restaurants are all very nice. Cons: Parking is limited and a bit pricey ($28/night for self-parking). The pool is tiny. Finally, the heating/cooling system includes motion sensor technology - it will shut down when you leave the room to conserve energy. This is a nice touch, but when it is hot outside the room will be rather uncomfortable upon entry.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge dropped the ball”
Reviews.Author: seejj
Reviews.Content: It was my mom & dad's 51st Wedding Anniversary and I wanted it to be special for them so I booked them a long weekend at the JW Indy. I booked a couples massage for them over a month in advance as well as flowers to be delivered to their room. I called only a few days prior to their arrival to confirm that everything was taken care of and they assured me of that. When my parents arrived there were no flowers in their room and the next day there was no massage for them. When I asked the concierge they said they had no records of any of this. However, I was promptly called by the hotel general manager and concierge manager who quickly made things right by cutting our rate and dropping our hotel cost and offering to personally go out and get roses and bring them for my parents and even delivered fruit and cheese plate to our rooms and assuring there would be massage reservation for the next day. They did everything they could to remedy the situation. We really felt taken care of. The price might seem a little high but for such nice facilities and breakfast and all day snacks and drinks provided it makes it a very good value for what you get. The gym is as good as most stand alone gyms. There's a really good social life in the lobby as well and nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great new downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamey88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indianapolis JW Marriott over Memorial Day weekend for the Indianapolis 500. It is a brand-new hotel, built for the 2012 Super Bowl (which BETTER HAPPEN). If the lady at the front desk had not told us that it was the first time that they were sold out, I would not have known. We were promptly greeted upon arrival and escorted to the check-in desk. As elite Marriott customers, we were automatically upgraded to an executive suite at no additional charge. The executive suite is a two-room suite with a living room and bar area, as well as a well-designed desk area, and two bathrooms. The suite was immaculate, bed was turned down, and room service arrived at the appointed time. Perfect service!

Reviews.Title: “Hopping New Hotel in Downtown Indy gives GREAT service and Food”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerGuy
Reviews.Content: OK, I've been disappointed recently in a number of hotels that claim to be first-class (are you listening, Westin Tampa Harbour?) but this hotel really, really reminded me of Great American hotels. Excellent, attentive service by LOTS of people. Great part of revitalized Indy. The hotel is positively charged with positive energy (it is apparently THE place to meet and greet in Indy these days). Tasteful rooms (not large, but not tiny) with outstanding views of the city. The food may be forget all the bad meals I've had recently. I had roasted chicken, something I don't eat a lot of on the road but eat at home, and it was THE best roasted chicken I've ever had. Negatives? Food is pricey, as you might expect. Internet access isn't world class, just OK. Rooms are on the smallish-size. But that is IT. This is the ONLY hotel I want to stay in, in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: johnawilson
Reviews.Content: Great room with a view of Victory Field. Staff very helpful. Hotel very clean

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, new...probably the best hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBriggs
Reviews.Content: The JW is brand new, having opened in 2011. Overall, the whole hotel just works nicely. Check in was easy, they walked me to the elevator (no idea why), the lobby is great with a nice bar off to the side, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel is just very pleasant and relaxing. The room I was in seemed typical (judging from the floor layout on the back of the door), super comfy beds, big flat panel TV, good lighting, and the bathroom was nice - not huge, but good sized. As noted in other reviews, it is odd how the bathroom door opens into the bathroom - it blocks the tub, and opens on the toilet. OK, that is fine, but personally if I designed it I'd open the door on the tub and not the toilet. But hey, we all have our preferences, eh? The hotel is basically on an urban trail, so you can do up to a 5-mile run out the door of the hotel (ask for a map), and it's next to the AAA ballpark (across the street). Parking is expensive, so look into options if driving (I was not), and as all higher end hotels seem to do, they charge for internet in the rooms (any why is it the cheaper hotels often don't?). In sum, it's a great business hotel in the center of Indy...certainly not a resort at all, but if you are in Indy looking for a resort you're in the wrong place.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Siamese4me
Reviews.Content: It was clean. Staff was very nice. Surprised when ice bucket and extra glasses were not removed by housekeeping...for several days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - comfortable big rooms”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: This is a nice new hotel in a good location. The glass full length windows made the downtown views awesome. I had a room right across from the AAA baseball stadium and could watch the game. The rooms are very large with a large tv with lots of channels. The hotel is designed for trade shows and has plenty of spots - but ends up with long walks. The food was good, internet very good. There is a TGI Fridays next door if you want food outside the hotel. A good tip - take the green line bus from the airport for $7! it picks up and drops off less than a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even more than I expected.....”
Reviews.Author: spencersbride
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel snob, admittedly. So believe me when I say this hotel is great! Thanks to a TA post, we parked across the street for $15/night available on weekends only ($28/night self park at the JW and ~$30/night valet). The hotel is well located and close to almost everything ($5 cab ride in the city if the walk is too long). There was a lot going on at the hotel (and downtown in general) this particular weekend when we checked in (wedding party, Seger concert, pay per view fight at High Velocity, prom) and the lobby was packed. However, we were greeted promptly and lead to a podium to check in without delay and even had a choice of rooms (king on 4th floor or 2 queen beds on 20th with city view). Brett was pleasant and helpful, but not too intrusive. After a quick check in, he walked us to our elevator while answering any questions and pointing out things about the hotel. He made sure the key worked in the elevator (very nice touch) and sent us on our way. The room was spacious, very clean and welcoming. There was nothing to complain about, but we did find it curious that we didn't have a mini-bar. That being said, there was a coffee maker with an assortment of teas, coffee, creamer and so forth, and 2 bottles of complimentary water. The view was amazing! (thanks again TA members!) We had a very pleasant meal at High Velocity (thanks to Emily) which is located right off the lobby then enjoyed a walk outside, a quick nap in those amazing beds, then grabbed a $5 cab ride to Conseco Fieldhouse for the concert. Again, this was a very busy weekend, but the doormen/valet were courteous and patient with everyone. Once back, we checked out the lobby (which was packed!) and crawled upstairs and back to those great beds! We hit the fitness center early and were very impressed! The equipment was top notch and plentiful, along with towels, water, and an assistant if needed. A bill for our stay had been placed under our door during the night and we thoroughly checked it for any excessive charges (sales and occupancy taxes only). Check-out was even easier than check-in, and we were on our way. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. There is so much to do within walking distance (minor league baseball, museums, river walk, NCAA headquarters, capital building, .....) and such a nice hotel to stay in while touring this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but something was just a little Off”
Reviews.Author: arubachristene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Indianapolis and were attending a gala downtown. It was being held at the hotel and we decided to make it a real date night and spend the night. Our first impression of the hotel was not so great - the valets were very friendly when we first pulled up. My husband wanted to stop the car for a moment to unload our bags. When we told them we wanted to self-park they were a bit rude about it. I was already out of the car with my bags when we were told we needed to go park in the garage (30 minutes of self-park is free). It was awkward and embarrassing. Once they knew we wanted to self park they just seemed to look right past us, even when my husband had a question... Once we parked and got inside things got a lot better. The lobby was beautiful and the woman that checked us in was fantastic! Very warm and friendly. I peeked into the "Velocity" bar, excited at first from seeing it on the website, but then realized it was too 'sports bar' for me - no cozy or comfy seating that I saw. We were lucky to get a room on a high floor. The room was very nice with windows ceiling to floor which I loved. The beds were super comfy - we slept great which is probably one of the most important things. The room was nicely decorated but didn't seem to have as much personality as some of the other JWs I've stayed at. And one weird thing - no light in the closet. While I guess you don't 'need' a light in the closet, that was one thing that struck us as strange. Bathroom set-up was a little weird too -- no bathtub but a big shower with extra jets. That was awesome but being a date night I would have liked the bath. And the bathroom door opened in a way that it blocks the shower door. (I'm weird - I like the door open if I'm just showering or getting ready since bathrooms can seem a little claustrophobic.) Then like most hotels they want you to save your towels, but don't give adequate towel racks (just the one on the shower door and a robe hook). Not that it mattered - we were just staying one night. None of these things were a big deal but made this hotel feel a little unfinished - like a few corners were cut or there were a few oversights. The lobby bar was nice and we did grab a cocktail. I think it was called Ginger Crush? It was great (muddled strawberries in it) but really sweet. And the rest of the cocktail menu needs help. Even the waitress gave us kind of a 'ya, I know' as we were sitting there a little lost while we read it. One of my favorite things about a nice bar is getting to try fun cocktails. I can't tell if it lacks imagination or of someone was trying to hard to be imaginative. After our gala we tried two other drinks there that were just weird. We ended up ordering late night room service - fish and chips, that were really good. Then we had room service again for breakfast which was ok. I had a wrap that was great but the potatoes it came with were soggy. That's ok - I didn't need to eat much after the late night service. =) Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel. Probably the best in Indy but doesn't compare with the JW (as I remember it) in San Francisco. Somehow I think even our JW here in Grand Rapids, MI is more chic. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if a good promotion was running and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “This IS a Big Deal”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this brand new hotel for a week long conference and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff are obviously trained to cater to the needs of every guest. My room on 29 had a great view, super fast elevator service and an awesome multi-headed shower. I used the laundry service three times and it was done perfectly, with same day service. Pickup the phone and there is instantly help on the line. Right night to the hotel is a AAA minor league baseball field and I enjoyed a night game there within sight of my room. Great access to the central canal with bike rentals and for general strolling. Breakfast buffet is copious and well prepared. The fitness center is topnotch with plenty of machines and free weights. Costs a bit more, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: A welcome addition to Indy... Great exterior and fantastic foyer. Something went wrong with the design of the room hallways, they look very typical 70's standard american hotel in my opinion. Service was well above expectations, on site restaurants were great, fitness centre and spa was excellent! Fantastic conference facilities also. 12.95 per day for interest which is annoying. Room Service menu was a bit unappealing to my tastes..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of Marriott properties across the country and the JW Marriott in Indianapolis is as nice as they get. The hotel is new and beautiful. The rooms are great -- very clean. The pool and health club are above average for a downtown hotel. The health club even has refrigerated bottled water (free) and chilled towels. The concierge lounge has great views of the city and serves delicious food in the morning and evening. You can't go wrong with this hotel. The JW is substantially nicer than the standard Marriott in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but need to work out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: AJR2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the grand opening. While the hotel is brand new there were definitely kinks to work out (elevator key didn't always work, charged additionally for parking, housekeeping was skipped one day, gift card wasn't applied to bill). However, they were always very pleasant and quick to respond. The fitness center was top notch and had great views of the city. Rooms and bathrooms were small and the decor was a mix of modern and deco. The rooms appeared to be more for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: expresser
Reviews.Content: you can definetely tell this hotel is brand new. My room was on 29th floor and overlooked the Colts stadium and the city...GREAT VIEW! The staff was excellent...The clerk not only checked me in, but walked me to the elevator while discussing all the features of the hotel...thought that was a nice touch. It is connected to the convention center which is a easy walk through 2 hallways and the lobby bar was lively during my stay. Not sure if I will ever have a reason to go back to Indy, but if I do...i would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is my pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: travelhound14
Reviews.Content: I heard this statement several times and I felt they meant every word. If you care about amazing service and amenities that are high end, this is the place for you. I throughly enjoyed the convention I was at and the staff made the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, service, but beware of "incidental charges."”
Reviews.Author: ALJARN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel/city as a late Valentine's Day celebration. The hotel just opened a few months ago. Rooms are very nice-large and comfortable with large windows. Comfortable chairs, desk area, flat screen TV, large closet. Bathroom was large with nice amenities. We had an upper room with views of White River State Park and the White River. Service was wonderful-from the clerk at the front desk through everyone we ran into until check out. All were very helpful, asking how we liked our stay, smiles...very much appreciated. Location was near several attractions-Indiana State Museum was across the street and within walking distance. Indy Zoo, White River Gardens, & Victory Field are all very close. We didn't use Internet or any other services. Valet/parking is available on site, but is $28 for regular parking/$32 for valet. There is a parking garage across the street connected to the hotel by a skywalk that is available for less than half the price that we utilized. We had breakfast in the Osteria Pronto restaurant-also very nice. Lots of the regular breakfast fare plus a made to order omelet bar. Lots of fresh fruit, danish...great assortment all around. And again, service was great. Very attentive without being overbearing. My only complaint about this hotel was the bill....a $50 "incidental fee" was tacked on to the bill when we checked in to cover damages or extras. No mention of this on the confirmation or at check in. Was assured it would be removed and credited to my card within a week. Suggested that they might want to mention this somewhere along the way so it's not a surprise when you check out. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a downtown Indy visit.

Reviews.Title: “Check your confirmations!”
Reviews.Author: dcdill8
Reviews.Content: In January we reserves a Club Level Guest Room, with a City View on the top floor. $455 after tax The room was booked on the jwindy.com website and claimed it had access to a Lounge where complimentary snacks, sodas, and breakfast could be found. I received a confirmation and have a copy on hand. I received a reminder confirmation the day before my check in date. I did not review it, since I had before. The confirmation number is the same and so is the $455 price tag. However upon arrival to the JW Indy... I was told the best available was on the 29th floor with a "Park View" the view was not what we reserves, the room was not located where we had booked it to be, We did not receive access to any lounge and breakfeast was an additional $16 a person. Not to mention.... The price tag remained the same! I have yet to get an answer as to how. The staff was polite and friendly, but it was obvious that they hotel is new and so was the staff. I'm trying to get better contact informatio, but want folks to CHECK YOUR CONFIRMATION! Don't get me wrong! THIS IS A GORGEOUS BRAND NEW HOTEL AND THE STAFF IS VERY FRIENDLY! THE LOCATION IS PERFECT AND THE BEDS COMFY. BUT SOME HOW MY CONFIRMATION WAS CHANGED WITH OUT MY DISCRETION AND I WAS STILL CHARGED THE SAME. PLEASE BE CAUTIOUS WITH YOUR OWN RESERVATION.\ OH AND WE WERE CHARGED FOR PARKING, WHEN WE HAD NO CAR.

Reviews.Title: “New Convention Hotel in downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: papat1002
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in conjunction with a conference that was on-site at the JW. Great convention space with assistance as I arrived in the parking garage below the hotel. Many staff helping with directions, etc. The catered meals at the JW were very good. The The hotel room was well appointed and comfortable. Nice views overlooking the baseball park downtown. Convenient to the downtown area without going outside through the elevated walkways connecting to downtown. The only area of concern was the noise from the heating and air conditioning system in the hotel room. The noise reminded of the through the wall units found in the economy hotels. Hope they can address this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Big, shiny and new but not as posh as expected”
Reviews.Author: beehostess
Reviews.Content: I thought the JW was to Marriott what the Conrad is to Hilton but I didn't find that to be the case. The hotel is massive and very state of the art with every bell and whistle you can buy today but I just thought it would be more plush and opulent. If you were blindfolded and put in a hotel room you would think you were at any nice upper scale full service hotel, including their full service Marriott sister hotel down the street. Service was pretty good except for I also experienced the problem with the key system which I was ok with, even though unlike another reviewer I did not get a nice note or any sort of turndown service for my inconvenience. However there was one problem with not having a key and that was gaining true access to the workout facilities. At check-in I asked about gaining access without a key and was told just to come back to the desk and they would let me in, ok no problem, but what they didn't say was that once you are inside of the exercise complex you need a key to move around freely. Without a key I couldn't even get in the women’s locker room to use the facilities. Why the place is locked down like Fort Knox inside the exercise room I have no idea but if you have a key you probably wouldn’t notice the inconvenience. On the plus side the equipment is all state of the art and plentiful! Aside from the key issue and my coffee/tea amenities in my room not being replenished during my stay everything else was fine. Employees were courteous and friendly. Lobby bar has a nice atmosphere with a drink menu that is fun and creative. I highly recommend the basil lime gimlet for a refreshing treat! Once they work through the opening hiccups they should be fine, but I'm still not sure the value is there for the hype I’ve heard over JW’s elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, trendy hotel and stellar service”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy, there was a minor glitch with their computer system so they could not get room keys issued but they had a hotel staff person take me to my room. They called shortly and dropped off room key and during turn down service they left a little popcorn treat and a card to apologize for the room key glitch earlier which was not a big deal, but I appreciated the gesture. The hotel and restaurant staff (Ate at High Velocity) was very attentive and friendly. LOVED the floor to ceiling windows, had a high floor room with great views. The fitness center was the best of the hotel gyms in the area and the hot tub was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very new but also very nice. Staff was overly friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: cdoctor2
Reviews.Content: Well done, JW! I felt welcomed and enjoyed my visit very much. The Executive Lounge was great and the staff was extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “New and shiny, clean and safe, but not remarkable”
Reviews.Author: FleetGuy
Reviews.Content: Check in went well and was given a room on the "B side" of the property overlooking the White River, and a few museums, a GM plant but not much else. The clerk walked me to the elevators but failed to tell me how to use my room key to access the floors above the third floor. The place still smells new (a good thing my wife stayed home) and the room was well appointed. I particually liked the iHome radio where I docked my iPod for the duration of my stay. The wakeup phone links you to a real person and not an automatic system. The king bed was equipped with a down comforter with a spare blanket, I shed the comforter and just used the sheets and blanket. You can hook your electronics up to the big flat screen through a panel of connectors, but I had to ask for the cords (no charge) even though the in-room literature said they were in the room, no big deal. The bathroom was a little skimpy on towel racks so the vanity was a little buisy. They do have recycling recepticals in the room (too bad my wife couldn't be here to see them. I only ate breakfast here, not a bad deal ($16.99), they even bring you your choice of newspapers. I opted for the internet connection and chose the basic (slow) service which was very slow. The second day I paid the extra $3.00 and got the much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new place to go.”
Reviews.Author: bubg08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went out for her birthday downtown and decided to stay downtown. I thought we should stay here. So I booked the room a few weeks in advance and it turned out to be the same night of Peyton Manning's Children Hospital Fund raising event with Kenny Chesney performing. The place was a ZOO, but the plentiful staff that was there to help was wonderful. I kind of got the feeling they would have helped me go to the bathroom if I needed it! lol The place is beautiful, clean, relaxing, very accommodating, and romantic. I wish we would have gotten the King room but we got two queens and slid them together so it was no big deal. The view of the city was great as well. Did not have time to go to the bar or restaurant but they both looked awesome. I would for sure go back!

Reviews.Title: “Almost There...But not quite”
Reviews.Author: LizaAllee
