Reviews.Content: Beautiful, New, Top Notch....unless they are hosting a large event! I chose the Marriott for its location, price and ambiance. The hotel is new, beautiful and in a great location. The rooms were well arranged, had great interior design and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was all very nice, very helpful and willing to step up and offer assistance. The real issue was that the hotel was 90% occupancy and the staff was happy to share that information in preparing you for service delays. The hotel entrance was congested and backed up into the intersection of Washington and West Street. The staff though nice, struggled to organize the mass amounts of patrons, valet parking management and general organization. The pool was so overrun that enjoying the facility was nonexistent. Both of my children were disappointed that we really could not swim and enjoy the facility. The restaurant and service good. If this is a test for Super Bowl 2012, they still have lots of steps to take to meet the expected customer service for a JW Marriott. Had I known that the hotel was at 90% occupancy, I would have chosen another hotel Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new...but”
Reviews.Author: kindhoosier
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW this past weekend. Booked a king room and when we checked in they gave us a room with two doubles. Not really what we wanted since nit what we booked. When called front desk was put on hold for ten minutes before told they had no king rooms available. Is it a huge deal? No, but when we stayed at the JW in Cancun I just got the feeling they would have built us the room we booked if they didn't have it and this place was just...not available, not even a sorry. They offered a key to the concierge lounge which from where we were you had to ride two different elevators to get to, exciting. We actually just cancelled an upcoming reservation we had here and are staying elsewhere. The other place not only takes your reservation but fills it correctly.

Reviews.Title: “An amazingly beautiful hotel...Service like no other.”
Reviews.Author: barros102181
Reviews.Content: Was recently in Indy for the Dealer Expo 2011 and stayed at the new JW Marriott. Just approaching the building is incredible - one of the most beautifully modern hotels I've ever seen. From the moment we walked in, the attention was on us. There is someone to help you around every corner and they don't have an attitude or seem like they are being bothered. My ONLY issue was the quality of sleep. I understand it is a brand new hotel and so the amenities are also brand new. With that being said, I would have slept better in the back seat of my car. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and all we had were down pillows - I ended up using the throw pillows to sleep on. With the lack of sleep aside, it was a wonderful hotel & we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Plush modern romantic experience”
Reviews.Author: smewtann814
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Indianapolis and took advantage of the hotel's Valentine's Day package for a one-night stay. The package included valet parking ($32), 4-course dinner at the hotel's Italian bistro, a high-floor room with a view, champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries. Any of the grievances I had likely related to the fact that the hotel had only been open for 8 days - i.e. slow service, popularity - but the staff made a significant effort to make things right. For example, Because of the popularity of the package and the hype of the new restaurant, reservations booked up without us even knowing. The hotel called us to suggest we book the 9:00p time slot (one of the few left) - which I was upset about because I don't like eating dinner that late. After expressing my disappoint, the hotel offered us complimentary in-room breakfast the next morning and a 2p late checkout. (Used sugar, not vinegar). Other frustrations included waiting 50 minutes for a second robe and waiting 20 minutes the next morning for toast missing from our order. Again, new hotel, new staff - forgivable. The food was very good. Osteria Pronto was elegant but not stuffy. We had a small issue with the waiter keeping our change as tip - which was uncouth- but it seemed to work out in the end. We were annoyed that we had to pay the tax and gratuity since the dinner was "included" in our package. They had a large selection of wines, but a small selection of ones that could be purchased by the glass or carafe. The prosecco was delicious. The food was plentiful - even for four-courses - and very good. My salmon was excellent, however the potatoes accompanying it were undercooked. Not a deal breaker though. I wouldn't visit the restaurant again unless I was staying at the hotel. In room dining (breakfast) was also elegant and plentiful. We both ordered the steak and eggs. My eggs weren't cooked right (how many people order "over hard"), but the steaks were cooked perfectly medium. Mine had an interesting "carbon" taste to the char, but I ate it nonetheless. Huge NY strip, too. The room was plush, modern, and romantic. The sheets were comfortable and the bed was soft. The decor is bright, modern, and a little funky but still elegant. The floor to ceiling windows are not for the faint at heart, but the views of downtown from floor 28 are stunning. The bathroom was also very nice. I was pleasantly surprised to find a spacious (room for 2!) shower with two extra shower heads. We felt extremely comfortable and at home in the room. The pool is small - no doubt - but the jacuzzi is a nice size. Parents seemed to apologize for the children often, but this was not so much the kids fault as it was the size of the pool. The location is phenomenal. The hotel is within walking distance to Monument Circle (please visit Giorgio's Pizza on the circle - classic, low key italian dining) and Circle Center Mall - less than 10 min walking. The hotel is also a short walking distance from White River State Park which has quiet paths that lead to the zoo, Indiana State Museum, and other museums and places of interest. Even on a mild winter day, it was a pleasure to stroll through the park. This hotel is HIGHLY recommended for couples who are either visiting Indianapolis or live within the city and want to get away for the night. Yay JW Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: FlyNavyCincinnati
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Indianapolis for the weekend. I found out that our trip coincided with opening weekend of the new JW Marriott. We booked it via the Marriott web site getting a very good rate. Overall the hotel is very impressive and the service was exceptional. We found the hotel no problem. It is directly across the street from the Indianapolis Convention Center and it is a short drive from downtown. Check in went very smoothly. We were immediately greeted by the valet as we pulled into the driveway. The Gentleman at the check in desk was also very helpful getting us a speedy check in then escorting my family and me to the elevator (nice touch). Our room was located on the 30th floor. The floor to ceiling windows enhanced a fantastic view of the city. As one would expect on a hotel's opening weekend, the room was spotless. The room has nice modern furniture and the bed's were comfortable. For Marriott rewards members, the Executive Lounge was extremely nice - one of the best I've seen. The hotel offers an indoor pool (kind of small) and a very nice fitness area. We did eat at the Velocity Sports Bar in the hotel. It was a nice casual restaurant with good food. One exception was my wife's steak which was way undercooked, but the waitress made it right and took it off our bill (without us even asking). I can't overstate how good the service was here. They certainly had plenty of staff on hand to help with every need possible. It was certainly a great opening weekend and I look forward to staying there again in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Indianapolis
